Reviews.Title: “Nice conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: B_RBoston
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel from March 23 - 29, 2012 for a conference and was pleased with it since it is right next to the convention center. Upon arriving, check-in was quick and easy. I was placed on the 18th floor of the South Tower (1843 to be specific) and had a gorgeous view of the bay. It appears that the majority of the balconies are on the North Tower, though. All I had was the standard hotel window that opened about 4 inches. It was your pretty standard Marriott room. A nice queen-sized bed, 32 inch flat screen tv, an over-sized chair with ottoman and a recently updated bathroom with marble counters and a nice glass enclosed shower. No bathtub though. I do wish that the shower head was a bit higher. I am 6' and I still had to duck a little to get under the shower head. Everything was clean and well kept, nothing disgusting about it what-so-ever. Now for the good stuff, the restaurants on site. First night I want to Roy's Hawaiian Fusion Cuisine, which is located right out back of the hotel near the harbor. What a great place! A bit pricey, but still worth it. I had the macadamia crusted mahi-mahi & it just melted in your mouth. Great cocktails here as well. On another day, I tried the Tequila Bar & Grille that is located poolside. It's a decent lunch with HUGE portions. If you are just hanging out by the pool (which by the way is AMAZING), this is a good place to grab a bite to eat. There are many other dining options available around the area. Just a quick walk North up the boardwalk is a slew of restaurants that all have fresh fish and nice harbor views. Then there is also the Gaslamp district (about a 5 minute walk) that has a little bit of everything available. Traveling by taxi to the San Diego Zoo cost ~ $15. Not bad at all. Coming back from SeaWorld cost ~$35. So if you don't have a car while you are there, options for transportation are available. The one thing that people should know about is the train that passes through at night. I personally wasn't too bothered by it most nights since it was just a passing whistle and I am used to city noises. But on the Wednesday night the train must have just stopped in front of the hotel and blew it's whistle for a good 30-45 minutes straight at 2 or 3 AM. Overall, I would say this is a decent place to stay in San Diego if you are visiting the convention center (or even going to a Padres ballgame) since it is close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Br00klynB
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with great views, wonderful pool and fitness center. Happy Hour at the pool rocks! The not-so-goods: The beds for some reason are not as good as in other Marriotts, the cleaning staff seemed a bit sloppy, the parking and WIFI are too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Easter Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Jason H
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, well situated for the Gaslamp area and Seaport village. Only 15min drive from sea world. Booked room with balcony and view over marina but was very disapointed with size of balcony as barely room for one chair. For price of room I would expect complimentary internet connection ($12.99) and car parking ($26) per day.

Reviews.Title: “nice location being run on a shoe string budget”
Reviews.Author: bigappletraveller
Reviews.Content: great location, garbage everywhere. tables by pool not cleaned for hours, pizza boxes and food in elevators, halls and common areas. long lines to check in and hardly any staff to do it. this is a poorly run marriott with a great location. i cant understand why there are 3 front desk staff checking people in with huge lines to do. and when our room wasnt ready we got to stand in the line again for the key. pool area has one person giving out towels and no one cleaning. our room wasnt ready until 4:30. they couldnt care less though as place was packed and i am elite with marriott and this was elite treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but avoid north tower”
Reviews.Author: Snloomis
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel. Stayed her for a conference. Wishw i had stay herw for the entire trip. Very clean, lots of amenities, and great staff. The pool and gym were great. Only draw back was on the north tower you face the train and trolley tracks and you can hear them all night. I had friends who stayed in the south tower and they didn't hear a thing. A good place to staff and the room rate wasn't too pricey.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay at a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ipeguy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the San Diego Marriott Marquis for six nights and it was a pleasant stay. The room was comfortable, the breakfasts were good, room service was overpriced but decent. My room had a fine view and was reasonably quiet. I would have preferred not to have to pay for my Internet connection. On the other hand, my TV was an HDTV and there were actually HD channels to watch for free.

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: danielt2011
Reviews.Content: Great views of the bay & marina. Right next to the convention center. Roy's restaurant out front was mediocre. Many better restaurants in the Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely... but not a peaceful refuge.”
Reviews.Author: Mighty10
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip to San Diego through a discount website... so I knew that we would not get a premium room. However, we has a beautiful, clean room with a balcony and a view of the city. If you were going to a conference at the convention center, this is an ideal hotel. And I have to say that the cleaning service was very good and the maid remembered a special request that I had made the day before. Truly, my only complaint is one which the hotel has no control over. There were two railroad gates that clanged closed repeatedly for the trolly and occasional train all day and almost all night. And a lovely 1:45 a.m. train that loved to blow the whistle. We were on the 21st floor and I felt like we were sleeping by the tracks. So my best advise... try for a harbor view. The city view is stunning... but noisy. The hotel was lovely and the pool area was very nice. It looked a lot like the Orlando Marriott with fire pits, long pools and hot tubs. It is very convenient for conventions and of course the trolly!

Reviews.Title: “My best birthday...”
Reviews.Author: marta1313
Reviews.Content: Staying at this gorgeous hotel, with a beautiful view to the romantic harbor was my fiancee's surprise for my birthday. The room is very romantic, where you can watch the boats cruising the harbor and the stuning sunset. Our suite was located on the 8th floor. The gaslamp, train, shops, are in walking distance. We also took the hotel boat and cruise to Coronado Island for dinner. For my birthday we had dinner at Roy's Hawaiian Fusion Cuisine features the finest seafood, hand cut meat, sushi and an award winning macadamia nut crusted Mahi Mahi with Lobster Sauce..I had a special cake, they were all very kind. The hotel also made us a surprise, we received a gift, a full tray with strawberries dipped in chocolate what a treat! we will be back soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at the marriot”
Reviews.Author: lmisch
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference at the convention center. Couldn't beat the location, very close proximity to the conference center, downtown, and the gaslamp area. Easy walking distance to those attractions at the train station. The room was immaculate and very comfortable. Our bay view was spectacular. The pool area was lovely and well kept. Internet in the rooms was free with the conference. I would definitely stay here again, for business or a personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway with the family”
Reviews.Author: XandertaffyZ
Reviews.Content: Just got back right now from our little family weekend getaway with the kids. Nice place down next too the marina. Got a great place by calling with a military discount it cut the price in half! We had a great view of part of downtown and the marina and Coronado island from our room 2506 on the 25th floor in north tower. Staff was helpful and nice. We had this tiny fridge in the room but it wouldn't hold much stuff and we had juices and snacks for the kids and my sons medicine. We called the lobby and they send up an extra fridge and a bigger older one that was ice cold. That was very helpful. We didn't have bath robes, we called and they sent up no problem. We had breakfast at the the hotel twice at the "DW" nice little buffet breakfast kids loved it. The wife and I had some awesome Huge Nacho plate and drinks poolside at the Tiki bar place. It looks awesome at night the pool is lit up this cool blue nice jacuzzis. Starbucks inside the hotel. Parking was steep 26 buck a day for self parking and 36 for valet per day!!! Overall great place close to downtown and restaurants, bars etc. I would go again.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous views, nice outdoor area, very big”
Reviews.Author: HoustonMoose
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel on a gorgeous harbor in a beautiful city. We stayed for a week and it was wonderful. It is comfortable, walking distance to gaslamp, train, everything. It is clean and well kept. Staff is nice. However, no personal attention as it is huge. Too crowded with conventions, etc but still enjoyable. Concierge lounge was very nice but was way overcrowded..

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Marriott properties!”
Reviews.Author: JoyceInDC
Reviews.Content: Phenomenal views, outstanding customer service, perfectly located. What more can I say? It was a sheer delight to stay here. I absolutely recommend it. One tiny criticism: lack of seating in main lobby. Would be nice when you're waiting for someone. Otherwise, absolutely NO complaints here!

Reviews.Title: “Fair room”
Reviews.Author: Nicetoeatout
Reviews.Content: NIce lobby area, too much husble bustle with conventions going on. Had to change rooms ...the first was really small with no tub. The second was not in great shape but had a tub.

Reviews.Title: “Too Big and too small at the same time”
Reviews.Author: hvbrasil
Reviews.Content: what really desapoint me in this Hotel, was the size of the bar and Breakfast area, If you will be attending a congress in the convention center next to this Hotel, be prepare to get in line for 15/30 minutes for a table for Breakfast as well as it is impossible have a drink in the bar. The Hotel is Huge and they have a such Small bar and Breakfast area for this all Hotel. The only good point is it was raining when I was there and it was very convenient and they have a inside walk through the convention area, so this was a ++ for this situation, all the rest it is a Marriot Hotel, nothing much different that you can expect to get from what you are paying for.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Cocojuv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our three kids ages 8-13. We loved the rooms, the view, the pools, the service and the location. We rented a car right in the hotel ( we didn't come through the airport), and had a great day in La Jolla. Loved J Wok, a nice 10 minute walk from the hotel, esepcially the dumplings and pork buns.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, especially for a conference!”
Reviews.Author: happyinvt
Reviews.Content: Stayed here from March 16 thru March 20. Despite unseasonably cold & wet weather, our stay was wonderful. The room was clean and we had a beautiful view of the city in the North Tower on the 9th floor. We slept reasonably well and did not experience the noise problems that were referred to by others in reviews we read. We ate breakfast every day from foods at the Starbucks on site. Despite the hotel being completely full, the staff was very helpful, available and kept the place running efficiently and well. Great exercise facility on the bottom floor. Not a single complaint overall. The restaurants in the Gas Lamp quarter were way overpriced but the food was fine just not spectacular. I would recommend sandwiches from a market called Cine just a couple street blocks from the convention center. Very

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient, especially if attending a conference at the convention center”
Reviews.Author: dermgoddess
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located and the rooms are very nice, especially the rooms with a balcony overlooking the marina. Big complaint is lack of on-site dining, for breakfast and lunch. One poolside lunch place serves mediocre food. The bar has surly wait staff who are not attentive or even nice. While at the hotel for a recent convention, many times we waited in excess of 30 minutes before we were noticed! And then drinks took forever. Thankfully the concierge lounge had wonderful accommodating people but the hours it was open were limited. I might have been less likely to "vo,plain" but it rained and was windy the entire time we were there, making it difficult to venture out between sessions.

Reviews.Title: “Nice convention hotel!”
Reviews.Author: livitup10
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in early March as I was attending a conference at the SD Convention Center. We stayed in the South Tower on the 24th floor. Got a pretty good view of the bay and the city ~ it was awesome. The only downside is that even being that far up, we could still hear the train nightly. Ate breakfast at the hotel. The breakfast buffet is pretty good with made to order omelettes and waffles. Also had dinner at Roy's which was good however portions are small for the price you pay. When the restaurant fills up, it gets pretty noisy. Check in was a breeze and the employees are very friendly and helpful. Room had two double beds and the bathroom is huge. Shower pressure was weak. Coffee maker was nice. The walk to the convention center took about 5-8 minutes. Could pick up coffee on my way to the center since the Starbucks was in the South tower. All in all, this is a very nice hotel in an area where you can walk to many restaurants or just stroll along the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: OlafBig
Reviews.Content: This is what a business hotel in a big city should be. Modern attractive decor, clean comfortable rooms and gorgeous city and harbor views. You can't beat the location, right on the harbor promenade and across the street from Gaslamp Quarter.Breakfast is good, but the hotel gets a lot of business traffic being located right next to San Diego Convention Center, so you may have to wait to be seated between 8-9 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Warminmn
Reviews.Content: No matter if you have city view or bayside view rooms each one offers it's own visual delight! Service is excellent. The hotel is right next to Seaport Village which has cheap and expensive food and shopping. Also a few blocks away from the Gaslamp district which offers more food and shopping. No reason for a cab....except back to the airport ...which a one way cab ride is less than $15.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TexasDad1836
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in the hotel for a workshop. Beautiful property. Numerous restaurants within easy walking distance. Staff was very helpful and courteous. Adjacent to the San Diego Convention Center. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel/Beautiful Property/good and close to the conference..but”
Reviews.Author: BlumaFelix
Reviews.Content: we were disappointed with the room layout.The check in service was great and so was the bell service.really very professional and you get immediate attention. On first walking into the room we were excited because our room had a nice little balcony and is was a very nice size room. The view was wonderful and I must say that even though we were close to the elevator it was very quiet. The bed was fine, lots of pillows but there was no turn down so if we took late showers we used damp towels. Seemed like once we got to our floor the service went downhill The room was clean but very simple..not more than 2 magazines for the wonderful area.The sink and closet were separate from the shower and toilet. My husband gets up much earlier than me since he needed to get to the conference and there was no way to not to wake me up with the lay out.Also if one gets up to use the restroom during the night and washes your hands that will wake up your roommate. I had to call the "at your service" person everyday for something. There is no direct phone line to housekeeping. I requested a shower cap.I got one for that day? There was a great coffee machine, but had to call to replenish the reg coffee on the 3rd day? Also, had to call for more toilet paper..there was not any extra roll anywhere. The last thing (which I really should have reported) was I left a shopping bag on the floor, and looked all over, could not find it. I was upset because I had left all the receipts in the bag and it was gone! I called the desk (again on the 5th day) and she was pretty sure all the trash would be gone but said she would check with head of housekeeping. I actually got a call back that the maid put the receipts on the desk near the computer area! Anyway, the waitress in all the restaurants and pool were nice and efficient. SOmeone told me I should try the Omni next time or the Gaslamp Hilton..maybe I will.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel right on the Harbor”
Reviews.Author: Diddy1818
Reviews.Content: No need to rent a car around here. The trolley stops right in front of the hotel (which can cause some noise during the night) but is very convenient to get to all of the interesting sights in San Diego. You can walk out of the back of the hotel and walk the entire San Diego Harbor. Also right across the street from the Gaslight District with dining, shopping, and nightlife. Enjoyed our stay, but ask for a pool view next time to cut down on the trolley noise.

Reviews.Title: “Wife along!”
Reviews.Author: SSGCt
Reviews.Content: Spent several days hanging while husband went to conference and really enjoyed the hotel. The pool was great and the surrounding marina was fun to explore.

Reviews.Title: “not impressed”
Reviews.Author: kimspokane
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night over presidents weekend. Hotel is easy to find and in a good location. The pier and marina area behind the hotel is fun to walk at night or day and area in front was easy walk to gaslamp dist, shopping. The hotel lobby was very sterile. They have a business center that is run by ups? There is also a starbucks on property but it has very long lines. The hotel has a very nice pool area with outdoor eating, bar, hot tubs... that look inviting from pictures but is not resort like in person. The overall feel of the hotel reminded me of a very large convention hotel complex that tries to pass itself off as a nice place for a resort stay with the latter just not fitting the bill. Rooms. We were given a two double bed room on the 25th floor with a city view and small balcony with seating for two small chairs and an end table. The room itself was clean, basic and business sterile. Popcorn ceilings. Reminded me of something I would think was extra special in the early 90's. Bedding, furnishing and decor were of course updated but nothing special. Beds comfortable. We were especially tired from a morning at Disneyland and subsequent drive to San Diego and visit to a college. We checked into our room and surved the pool area. There is an area with a bar and outdoor seating/fire pits however this area was too crowded to eat so we ate along the pier someplace. Fun walk around the marina area. Came back to hotel to hot tub but I declined after having to move several beer bottles, plates of food, wet towels.. out of the way. I was very tired and looking forward to a good nights sleep after a busy day. There was a large group party in the room below us. It was only 9:30pm so I was not going to ruin their party by complaining of noise. The party was noisy but not out of control. You do hear the trains but that did not bother me enough to inturrupt my sleep. I had trouble getting to sleep, something I normally don't have a problem with, and awoke at midnight to extreem noise. The people in the room next to me were pounding on the walls, yelling at the party below me and shouting at the top of their lungs. I called and complained at 1am. It stopped for a few mins and then started back in again intermittently for the rest of the night. I'm not talking a noisy group of people here. I'm talking about men in their 20's screaming at the top of their lungs and pounding on walls. I got little sleep and was a wreck the next am. I did complain to the front desk. They appologized and comped our self park after I asked them to. They also offered us a late check out which I was unable to take them up on because we had to drive to Santa Monica. To their defense they did say that the party scene was not the norm and they had over 20 noise complaints that night. They said it is typically a great family place to stay. To be honest I would not stay here again even if I had a good nights sleep unless I had to for business and I did not pay for it. It was just too business convention and sterile with no real feel of resort to me. My opinion of this hotel may be slightly tainted on the negative side due to the crazy sleepless night which evidently is not the norm according to hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view of pool and marina!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie M
Reviews.Content: Our waterfront room was on the 20th floor, a well appointed room with a fabulous view/balcony.Our original room was on the 6th floor with an enclosed balcony. As view is extremely important to us, we immediately returned to the front desk. We we're then looked after by "Hela" who was great.She immediately found our new room and blocked a room two doors down for the arrival of family the next day. My only room complaint is is no bath tub, shower only. Had drinks and Mexican food by the pool, good food and excellent service. Location is fantastic, easy, lovely walks right out the door.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DetroitareaKate
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in San Diego, although my most recent stay was for a work conference. We had a marina side room and the view was spectacular. The room itself was nice with a comfortable bed. The details of the hotel is why I have given it 5 stars. The service was great from the second we walked in. There is fruit flavored water waiting as you check in (delicious). We tried only one of the restaurants, but all of them looked amazing. The pool is beautiful. There is an outdoor restaurant/bar that we loved. If you can grab a fire pit, it is an amazing place to have a couple of drinks. There is a Starbucks in the lobby if you choose not have the coffee in the room. Seaport village and downtown San Diego are just a short walk...everything is pretty much at your finger tips. I read many reviews about the loud train, but I only heard it once- was not a problem for us. Would definitely recommend this hotel and I would stay here again... maybe with a balcony this time :-)

Reviews.Title: “Really good quality hotel-restaurants a touch lacking.”
Reviews.Author: RichardBJ
Reviews.Content: Our room had a really beautiful room... 19th floor... View right over the gorgeous marina. The quality of fitment and cleanliness were great... General ambiance also great. A real plus point is that the staff were all lovely!! Including bell boys and cleaners et al. Comfy bed, all very plush. Room decor style reasonable, but we felt the corridors and all a little bland... I liked that there were no mirrors in e lifts... I always get a shock at how bad I look in those big elevator mirrors! Internet $13 per day and a little flaky, but this is common in hotels. Plumbing; I know there are hundreds of millions of Americans and the USA is the most powerful nation on earth... So I want to tread carefully here... But how come we need "toilet plungers"? Not only was a plunger provided... It was necessary :( We were on the 19th floor for goodness sake.. surely gravity should work?!! Restaurants were a little lacking. Here's what we have... LC's breakfast only, didn't go there. Sarbuck's stall... Tended to be a bit busy. The OUTDOOR Tequila bar and grill. Shut when it rains, freezing when it is dry and it's February, even when it was open we didn't fancy that. Roy's, look that up separately. Good but pricy and rather off campus. Lounge bar.... For a lounge bar, really good..l but way too busy... Due to the lack of indoor alternatives, in the rain, or on chilly evenings, and just fancying something quick.. you are trapped with the bar as your only option. Put in another indoor restaurant and earn another star!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a Conference”
Reviews.Author: sdt410
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for four nights for a conference in February 2012. Even though I did not pay personally for the stay, I did not think that their rates were out of line with other hotels in major cities. My room in the south tower was awesome, with a beautiful view of both the city and the bay. The sunrises were beautiful. The room itself was spacious, clean, and well-equipped. I had the best nights' sleep on this room's king-size bed that I have ever had in a hotel. (I personally did not even notice the trains in the night, although my room faced in that direction -- that's how well I slept.) The desk area had a panel that allows you to plug in up to four devices, plus it had input plugs for HDMI, laptop DVD's and other audio/video plugs. I assume that these would allow you to watch a movie or play a game that was your laptop, with the video showing on the widescreen plasma TV monitor. The bath was spacious with a walk-in shower with a rainforest shower head -- ah, bliss! No problem with water pressure or temperature. I agree with other writers that prices in the hotel shops were very high. While the floor vending machine had soda for $2.00, the price at the gift shop was $3.49. Hotel staff were uniformly pleasant and knowledgeable. My companions and I ventured out into the Gaslamp district for dinners, and found varying quality, mostly chain restaurants (Hard Rock Cafe) or what I would consider to be overpriced touristy restaurants ($10 for a side of broccoli with a steak!) sandwiched between bars of all types and touristy shops and boutiques. We also took the ferry to Coronado Island one evening and checked out the San Diego Zoo, both great experiences. All in all, a great place for a conference and a wonderful hotel for a home base.

Reviews.Title: “For those that can afford it, first class accommodations.”
Reviews.Author: Pickyonejustme
Reviews.Content: I typically don't spend the money to stay at 4 and 5 star hotels. However, this trip I was attending a conference next door at the convention center and it was the most logical choice. Upon arrival, I was pleasantly greeted by a staff member who made me feel welcome as I awaited check in. My room had a nice bay view with a walk out balcony and a couple of chairs to relax in. The room itself was pleasant albeit not huge. Furnishings were adequate but not noteworthy. The bed was extremely comfortable with plenty of pillows to suit anyone's needs. The bell staff was extremely helpful in retrieving some trunks that had been left for me prior to my arrival. They even offerred to help me transport them to the convention center, which I politely declined. I discovered the hard way that if you decide to go down to the lobby gift shop late at night to get a snack, make sure you bring lots of cash. A couple small snack items and a Pepsi was over $17.00.....ouch! The same $4.00 Pepsi could be obtained at the vending machines on each floor for $2.00, I found out after the fact. The breakfast buffet at the restaurant in the north tower was tasty and a chef would prepare eggs to your liking if you were so inclined. I opted ahead of time not to bring my laptop since I find it ridiculous to have to pay $13.00 a day just for internet access. I also opted to not get a rental car since parking charges are extravagent. A shuttle from and to the airport is $16.00 round trip. Everything else I did was within walking didtance of the hotel. Overall, I had a fine stay. Staff is very friendly and helpful. There are plenty of amenities (most of which I didn't partake of).....lounges, restaurants, fitness areas, etc, etc. on site that would offer just about anything one would require.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Laurie C
Reviews.Content: I went here for a Conference in February 2012. The rooms were very clean, the staff was very friendly and extremely helpful, and the hotel was very beautiful. I would LOVE to stay here again. It was the best hotel I have ever stayed in!

Reviews.Title: “Good for business”
Reviews.Author: BizTraveler873
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel many times. In general, the hotel is good for business travelers. The staff is always exceptionally nice. The accommodations are nice, but not plush. The wired internet connection is adequate, but could stand to be faster. The television channels are very limited and the quality is sub-par. The concierge lounge staff are very friendly, and the food service is good. As some have noted, the parking is very expensive. The location is great. It is a great location for runs/jogs/walks along the bay - you can go for miles without a stop light or street crossing. The gym is good.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - but thank goodness my company was paying”
Reviews.Author: cincom_traveller
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the Marriott, although it was out my habitual league. The building is beautiful, the rooms are spacious, comfortable and very clean and the staff is very helpful. I was a little disappointed by the breakfast - felt more like the breakfast of a 3-star hotel. The location is top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Not good for a family vacation”
Reviews.Author: TheBrites
Reviews.Content: We got a good price on this 4 star via a name your own price website. The employees were friendly, check in was easy, and everything seemed clean. The view was great. Now the negatives: the biggest for me was the outrageous parking cost - $26 per night for self-park (more for valet). It literally cost us more to park the car than to rent it... including gas! Compounding this fee was that we had to walk approx 2 blocks to get to the elevator to our room from parking. Our room overlooked the bay... which also overlooks the pool/bar. And the pool/bar was noisy at night, even late. We had to close the door to the balcony that we paid to upgrade to because that was the only way we were going to get sleep. Finally - this hotel got really busy Friday night - there are lots of meeting rooms and it is next to the convention center. Had to wade through a ton of convention-goers, all with the obligatory drink in hand. The elevators were extremely slow - i had unloaded our car and slogged the two blocks from the parking with our luggage, then had to wait about 8 minutes for an elevator headed up. By this time, quite a crowd had gathered. I got lucky and was standing in front of the one that opened, but quite a few people were left to wait for another one. $20 for a roll-away was a bit steep. All in all, I would not stay here again for a family outing. We liked having Roy's on the property, but that was the biggest benefit we saw.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: AMB69_11
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and friendly upon arrival & check-in. The rooms were average and the bed was uncomfortable. I was in town for a conference so I really expected/needed to sleep well. The onsite Starbucks is great! As far as location, it does not get any better. The hotel is very close to the airport and the Gaslamp Quarter is only a 10-15 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: tianapat
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel! We had a wonderful stay! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Marquis San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Izzyl11
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Marquis over President's weekend. Booked bay view with balcony but we were checked into a city view room with balcony. I went back downstairs and we were quickly moved to a great room on the 15th floor overlooking the pool and marina-- what a view! We had breakfast every morning in the restaurant on first floor. Wonderful service, everyone was pleasant and the buffet was tasty. This hotel is in a perfect location. It is a bit pricey but we were very pleased with our stay. Happy hour at the lobby bar and Tequllla bar were a good value, too.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Girls Trip”
Reviews.Author: crc102
Reviews.Content: I recently went on a fun trip with friends to San Diego and stayed at the San Diego Marriott Marquis & Marina. It was the perfect location for a quick 4 day trip, We purchased a 2 day pass for the Trolley Car and the stop was right in front of the hotel. It was perfect as we did not rent a car and used this to do our sight seeing. The hotel room was great, had a small balcony and get views. It was a little loud a night because of a transit system that runs all night. The pool and the bar at the pool was wonderful, so was Roy's Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Best overall service I have ever received!!!! ;)”
Reviews.Author: Pitufa17
Reviews.Content: This is hotel is perfectly located facing on one side downtown San Diego and the other side the Marina. The view is spectacular, the service is amazing. Every concierge, and every clerk we asked questions knew where to direct us. They even gave us tips about how to get to places, what to do first, an what was the best time to do it. Hotel is located 4 blocks from the Gas Lamp district where you can find shops and restaurants to pick from. Great area, and fabulous service. I am very pleased with our stay. Oh they have flavored natural water in the lobby for guests to drink. One with delicious strawberries and the other one filled with limes. Great idea and very refreshing. Also for the coffe lovers, there is a Starbucks in the South Tower of the hotel. Loooovvvveeeedddd it!!! ;). I will stay there again in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Kenjini
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally right on the marina, I had a gorgeous view of the waterfront. 51 of however many in San Diego? That seriously fails to take into account that they recently completed $200 million dollars worth of renovations. I had a suite at the Marriott Gas Lamp and a suite at the Marriott Marquis/Marina, the Marquis Marina was 1000x more amazing than the Gas Lamp room. It took your breath away and breathed new life into my energy levels whenever I walked in. Don't get me wrong, the Gas Lamp Marriott is extremely nice in terms of amenities (and they have a free breakfast for platinum) but there NO contest between the suites. Pros: Amazing Room (suite was HUGE with beautiful view) Amazing Location - Directly next to convention center Amazing View (Marina side of course, not sure about city) Amazing Staff (handle large volumes of clientele checking in very well) Massive pool heated to 80 degrees (I hear, didn't get a chance to try it). Large quantity of shops inside hotel. Cons: No free breakfast for platinum members? C'mon, serious downside... $250 for a regular room, I stay in Marriotts 80 nights out of the year and you can't throw in a breakfast? I've never stayed at a full-service Marriott in any state and not received a free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Marriott, But Room Was Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: skinnycrissy
Reviews.Content: We really liked this Marriott. They have a wonderful pool and pool bar with good food and reasonably priced food. The pool area is landscaped beautifully with waterfalls and palm trees with two hot tubs. We arrived on a Saturday night and wanted to order food at the pool bar which was very busy and many people were eating. However, we were told at 8:50 on that we missed last call on food! We found this to be unbelievable! It was Saturday night and there were lots of people there to spend money. The bartender was not about to budge and was rude! We left and went to Roy's. We really wanted a beer and nachos or quesadillas but they were not on Roy's menu, but they were very accommodating and made us a quesadilla. The room was extremely noisy. Our room overlooked the city and we were directly above the trolley. The trolley runs very often and we were "ding ding ding" all night from the trolley gates. Then when the freight train goes by, they blow their horn for approx. 30 minutes constantly. We mentioned it to the front desk, but they did not offer to move us to a different room. We were told that we need to contact the city about it because it is a problem for the hotels along the waterfront. I am considering writing the mayor. Did not care much for room design. We prefer a room design where the toilet and dressing mirror is separate. And the bathroom door automatically shuts which is very annoying. We don't always want the bathroom door shut. For example, I like to be able to listen to the TV while getting ready, therefore, I would have to prop up the bathroom door with something heavy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location - Overpriced - Try the Hilton instead”
Reviews.Author: greatday099
Reviews.Content: Lovely location but nothing special in the way of treatment if you are a Marriott Elite Gold member. Hotel booked in conjunction with a Conference. Extremely overpriced hotel rooms compared with other similar-class hotels on the water. Received no help from the front desk in extending an extra night or even with a late checkout to accommodate the end of the conference at 3pm. Moved to the Hilton on the waterfront for $100 less per night where I received a nicer view and much better treatment for the last nite of the conference.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MSelmi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here a few times for business. Very convenient location as noted by everyone - right next to the convention center and across the street from the Gaslamp district, so it's considered within stumbling distance from the drunken reveling that is Market Street. Would recommend the newer, updated tower. The rooms are decent, great pool with an immense waterfall if you are a pool user. Nice grounds & property, but like most Marriott's, don't waste your time with their restaurants. The inland waterway is right behind the hotel, so there's also lots of places to eat and hang out on the water. It's a big hotel, so the service is hit or miss.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for both business and leisure”
Reviews.Author: chicagotraveler9411
Reviews.Content: Right next to the convention center and a short walk to the gaslamp district for night life. All of the rooms have been recently renovated, my room had a large walk in shower but no bathtub. Some portions of the south tower is still being renovated and the restaurant is still closed due to the renovation. Super friendly staff from the moment you walk in to the front desk staff, valet parking attendants, and housekeeping. Ask for higher floor rooms overlooking the marina in the newly renovated south tower.

Reviews.Title: “Budget aside, a very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: taarhaug
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for almost a full week during the TMS 2011 conference. I did not pay for the stay, so the budget is not review. I asked for a room view seaview, and I got one. The view over the marina was very nice. The room was large and pretty nice. The location was excellent for strolls along the shoreline or to eat in the gaslight district. For the business traveller, this is a good choice when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “High End Marriott San Diego Gas Lamp & Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: JVBV
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this location a couple times. It's an excellent hotel directly adjacent to the Convention Center and two blocks from the Gas Lamp District. Views of the bay are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the marina”
Reviews.Author: CPJanuary
Reviews.Content: Great location, near of Gaslamp and downtown. Is proximally to marina and USS Midway Naval Museum. Ideal for kids with very good attention in restaurants of the hotel. The breakfast was very nice and he had variety of bread, fruits and homelettes.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to the Marriott”
Reviews.Author: kiwiaz
Reviews.Content: I had a choice of hotel, either the Hyatt (where the conference is) or the Marriott which is right next door. I went with the Marriott as I have never (until now) had a bad experience with the Marriott. Arrived, and found used band-aid on the floor of the bathroom, no soap, no shampoo, only conditioner and started to wonder if they even cleaned the bathroom from the person before. YUK!. Next day I went to the conference at 7:00am and had a break between 1:30p-2:30p, went to the room for a much needed break, and the room had not even been serviced..How long does it take? Felt if I took a nap and placed the "do not disturb" sign on the door the room would never be done, so I went to the pool. One good thing I guess if I am at the pool the internet is free, in the room its $13 from noon to noon.add up the charges, $13 for internet, parking is $26 a day. should have stayed at the Hyatt it was the same price, and my colleagues have had a better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TexGX
Reviews.Content: This is the typical convention hotel. Great location with plenty to do within walking distance. The rooms are clean and have great views.

Reviews.Title: “a bit disappointing”
Reviews.Author: TravelNut505
Reviews.Content: its a Marriot so there is a standard and in most cases it is met so I really debated even adding a review on this property but I thought i should add as there a few things to know about this hotel that may not be evident without staying here on the plus side 1) it is really hard to beat the location - close to gaslamp district/downtown - you can walk to many attractions, restaurants etc 2) staff is very good - up to Marriott standard and all indications this is a well run hotel on the not so good side -avoid the city view rooms - there is trolley/light rail that runs within block of hotel - the convenience to public transpot is nice - the downside is it is very load as every time the trollye comes by (every 30 to 60 mins) there is a loud alarm that is very audible even from the high floors (im on 14) -wireless internet is practically dial up speed , for a hotel of this size/quality it is below par and if you are traveling on business it is annoying and a bit unexpected

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: jakittel
Reviews.Content: I rarely (read: never) stay at hotels that are this fancy. I just don't have the money. But I was in San Diego for a professional conference and had funding, so I decided to stay at the conference hotel. The hotel itself was beautiful. We had a room that looked over both the pool and the bay. I spent a lot of time on the balcony! The staff were incredibly friendly at every encounter with them. The pool was clean and beautiful and there were many places to sit and enjoy the view. The bed was also very comfortable. But...The room was more than I would be willing to pay normally. Room service was absolutely ridiculous, as were the prices of the food in the restaurants located in the hotel. I am still baffled at how you can charge >$20 for pasta! Also, all of the restaurants except the bar closed early (and Starbucks closed at 5!). Internet was $12.95 per day, so I did not pay for it. Overall, the hotel was very nice, and I greatly enjoyed my stay. My wallet, however, did not.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: dsslv
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with a great location. The hotel amenities are very nice. Beautiful pool that overlooks the harbor. For a great excursion take the harbor taxi across the harbor to Coranado Island and walk to the Hotel Del Coranado for lunch. It takes approximately 30 minutes to walk from the water taxi to the Hotel Del Coranado. Also a bus runs every two (2) hours.

Reviews.Title: “Great views, surprisingly nice”
Reviews.Author: lisathethinker
Reviews.Content: Was worried a bit when reading past reviews, but was very pleasantly surprised. Bay view room was wonderful, and on 14th floor was just enough above pool to avoid any day and evening noise (train horns went off all night - but not hotel's fault). Room was very large, with good amenities (fridge, spacious bathroom, comfortable bed and pillows). Registration/check-in staff was very friendly and lobby/concierge staff were great in recommending local restaurants. Internet access was a real annoyance (ridiculous to be charging hotel guests $13/day, when lobby/pool internet is free), and 'free' areas didn't connect easily during high use periods. Didn't try out the restaurants/bars, but pool area was very pleasant and access to seawall for strolling/jogging is very convenient. The mandatory valet parking (even for dropping off/picking up rental cars) is a bit inconvenient, but tolerable. The valet employees were very pleasant and friendly. Overall, decent value for money, especially if using the convention centre. Cheaper places nearby, no doubt, but probably not with the wonderful view. A really nice hotel in convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Lyn T
Reviews.Content: The staff was awesome and like the renovations...beautiful building and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Our family visit”
Reviews.Author: Mohanarangan
Reviews.Content: Our room was facing the harbour and we were staying in the 10 th floor. Pool and the fitness center were of high quality and standard. Visted Sea world and spend a whole day with family. Bars and restaurant at downtown were serving good food,

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Property!!”
Reviews.Author: Deb H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January for business. Although the South Tower was not completely open, the hotel looks fabulous after the renovations so far. Loved the fire pits by the outside bar/pool area. My room was very nice with a great view. Highly recommend if you are in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Rachel S
Reviews.Content: it was my first time in San Diego and loved the location of the hotel so close to the convention center. It was important for me since I was a speaker at the PCMA 2012 San Diego. The service was great, staff is very pleasant and helpful. I also missed my shuttle to the airport, so their concierge got on his own cell phone to call the shuttle company and arranged for my pick up. I would go again in a heartbeat. Loved the pool, the firepits by the pool, the view... ahhh I loved it all

Reviews.Title: “Great location, easy access to convention center”
Reviews.Author: Jetchic
Reviews.Content: Hotel was still under renovations. Rooms were great, quiet and had great views. Restaurants not all open, making for longer wait times for breakfast on the weekends when the concierge lounge was closed. Staff is excellent and very helpful. Do not use the UPS store in the hotel. They rap you! Cost me 8 dollars for a small pck of super glue. You can go to FedEx office up the road for all your business needs for a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Best Marriott I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: mdahess
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was top-notch. I arrived and proceeded directly to the elite check-in and was briefed on everything I needed to know about the hotel. My room faced the harbor was large and comfortable. The Concierge's lounge had the best breakfast I've had at any hotel. The hotel had two bars, one by the pool that also served a small Mexican themed meal. The bar also had heat lamps and tables with gas fireplaces so one could stay outside even in chilly weather. The pool area was large and had a Hawaiian feel to it. The other bar, located inside, had pub food and was also a nice place to relax. While the restaurants were still under renovation, one could eat at Roy's (between the pool and the harbor) or a short walk will land you in the Gas Lamp District. The only dings I could say was that parking was not real close (but it allowed me to walk through the pool area every day) and the train that went by blowing its whistle. Minor issues that definitely can be overlooked because of how good everything else was. I look forward for when my travels land me back in San Diego so I can stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, great amenities, great location...but noisy trains!”
Reviews.Author: Growers
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because it was in the more desirable Marina district as we were traveling with our young daughters by train from Orange County. We weren't sure how we'd like the downtown hotels near Broadway. We wanted someplace within walking distance from the station and walking distance to attractions/restaurants/shopping. We got all that and we were happy with the beautiful view and the price was right! To check in we had to wait in line - that was a first for me. The line took about 15 minutes to get through. Once we had the key in our hand, we were off and running to enjoy our 24 hours in SD. We tried out their pool on a breezy, chilly December afternoon - the kids were happy even with the kiddy pool closed. The great outdoor bar nearby provided the entertainment for the parents. But I wouldn't take the kids to the fire pit areas once the evening hours hit. Quite a bit of romantic PDA going on. We were so happy to find that the Children's Museum was so close - 3 min. walk and a great playground was there too. The BIGGEST downside was the HUGE freight train that went through downtown at 2am! It blew it's horn f-o-r-e-v-e-r!! And it echoed through the whole downtown - I can't imagine anyone sleeping through that - although our kids did! :) The one that went through town at 6pm was entertaining for all to watch, but 2am, really! Not the hotel's fault obviously, there should be some noise ordinance rules or something...so I am giving this hotel a "4" because of the unfortunate train experience. We did not eat at the hotel - explored flavors of SD instead. We had a very disappointed 9 year old when we told her that we wouldn't pay for the very expensive room service! We strolled over to the Seaport Village for a mediocre breakfast at Edgewater Grill (cold hot chocolate!). Overall, great hotel - mega big, but great! We'll probably try something a little different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for business meeting”
Reviews.Author: cardio-2
Reviews.Content: Here for 2 days for business meeting. Rooms are well appointed, buffet food acceptable to good. Great location to mosey around after meetings. Only drawback is internet access is up to 12.95 per day!

Reviews.Title: “Good for convention stays or local visits”
Reviews.Author: RyanS1
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel for convention stays, or if you are visiting the area. within walking distance of all downtown attractions. Hotel is very nice and clean, staff is supper nice and helpful. Parking is not the best, best just to skip the car if you can. Internet speed was very good but expensive. I did not eat at any of the restaurants, but they appear very over priced, you can get a better deal in the Gaslamp district which is just several blocks away. If you are platinum Marriott member you get access to the executive lounge which has a very good free breakfast.There is one bad thing about this hotel, the rooms in the south tower are not sound proof, you will hear the person next to you. My colleague had a city view room, you will hear the trains at 10 pm, 2am, and 4am so ask for ear plugs, which they do have at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Recently-renovated, modern hotel with great views meets convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Travelin_JC
Reviews.Content: I passed five nights at this hotel, for business. My room in the North Tower featured the aforementioned small balcony and great views of the marina, and the bridge to Coronado Island. It appears the hotel was recently renovated, with new carpeting, paint and lighting fixtures. The pool area is vast and beautiful. The hotel's location to the Gaslamp District, Petco Park, and Seaport Village could not be more convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Service and Location!”
Reviews.Author: MiloTheExplorer
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Marriott for 5 nights for a conference in January 2012. Right away, I was impressed with the hotel staff who was very welcoming. There were quite a few of people all checking in at the same time and the staff had a great system for checking us all in very quickly. I had a great room in the North Tower, that had a balcony and a gorgeous view of the marina, Coronado and the ocean. The downsides of the hotel are the number of dining options and the lack of a spa. However, I understand they are currently building a brand new spa and it should be done sometime in 2012. The Tequila Bar & Grill was great for lighter food and had an awesome spot out by the pool, complete with heaters and fire pits. LC's Restaurant was just OK and I only ate breakfast here once. Roy's, of course was delicious and I highly recommend the lobster tail. Overall, this was a great experience at the Marriott Marquis, especially since there are tons of dining options just a short walk away in the Gaslamp Quarter. I'll be back in October and hope I have an equally wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: greattimeskj
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently stayed at this hotel for three nights. We stayed in the south tower and had a great view of the city. The rooms were very clean and modern. The beds were extremely comfortable. It is so close and within walking distance to the Gaslamp District and Seaport Village. The pool area is gorgeous with waterfalls and fire pits. No complaints at all! We will stay here again when we return to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view, great service, beautiful room!”
Reviews.Author: stephaniewilson1231
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott for 4 nights and found it wonderful! We were immediately greeted at the door with great service and had lots of help. Our room was on the 21st floor of the north tower and we had a beautiful view looking over the marina and pool area. We used the concierage a lot to help us find places to eat and they had lots of information as well as magazines for us to look through! The day we spent relaxing by the pool was wonderful, the only downside was that because of the pool location there is a lot of shade. But we just moved around a few times and enjoyed food from the onsite bar. Our room was wonderful as well, very clean and well cared for. We chose to upgrade to a balcony which was well worth the extra money!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous views. Location.”
Reviews.Author: BookinIt
Reviews.Content: My North tower suite included a balcony with a spectacular view of the Marina and bridge leading to Coronado Island. It doesn't get much better than that, anywhere. My issue with the hotel after a lengthy, six night stay is with the room amenities. Poor pillows, no bottled water, lack of HDTV signal and a shower that comes on and off every minute or so. A few tweaks would make this a 4 star review and for just a night or two here you'll be fine. PS Be sure to ask for a room that faces the Marina, otherwise you might hear the passing trains all day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Really Disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: adw
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because it looked so great from the photos and the location looked perfect. Although it was the most expensive of our trip (3 weeks travelling down the coast) we felt we deserved a bit of luxury over the New year. Sadly we were very disappointed. Not only do you get charged to park ($24 self, $36 valet) you get charged for the internet in the rooms ($12 a night) when there's free wifi everywhere else in the hotel - disgraceful considering guests from neighbouring hotels are welcome to wander through. Also - even the bottled water in the room (usually complimentary in even the most basic of hotels) was adorned with a note saying 'You will be charged $4 if this bottle is opened'. On our first night we were put in a disabled 'city view' room as it was the only one left with a king bed. The room itself was nice enough but no sleep was had at all due to the NOISE POLLUTION. This is the NOISIEST hotel room I have ever tried to sleep in. The trains and wafer thin walls meant I really needed to use the (only thing that is 'complimentary') earplugs! We changed rooms to a semi - sea view on the second night but could still hear neighbours. The Starbucks was shut (as was the whole south wing of the hotel) for renovation. We dined in Roys on the waterfront which was pleasant enough but vastly expensive for what it was - a restaurant within a hotel complex. Very disappointing all round. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Bowl fun”
Reviews.Author: Cooltreats
Reviews.Content: What a nice property close by the airport for the Holiday Bowl event. The Marina area is the best, so fun, lots to do, all within walking distance to the Gaslamp area, next to the Seaport Village for shops and food, Petco park, the convention center and USS Midway. San Diego has done a great job offering lots to do while in the area. Room with bay and partial city view in the north tower with balcony. Self park was $26 per day which is steep but you could really do without a car if you stay in this area. Trolley system was great. We drove over to Coronado Island to see the hotel and to the world famous zoo. Well worth both visits. Weather, California style, was perfect as well.

Reviews.Title: “Our Go To Hotel in SanDiego”
Reviews.Author: farawayMN
Reviews.Content: We have stayed countless times at this hotel over the years. It is our "go to" hotel whenever we visit San Diego. The bay view balcony rooms are the best - We love relaxing on the balcony and watching the ships. The bedding is new and comfortable. The location can't be beat - close to everything in the downtown embarcadero area. The newly renovated pool area is great. The amenities are wonderful, the concierge lounge is one of the finest we have ever visited. They have a wide variety of food, and the quality is quite good. Self parking is easy and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Not Marquis”
Reviews.Author: tolopez
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Marriott on San Diego's bay from 12/29-01/01. We booked it for 3 reasons. 1st we are Marriott Elite members. 2nd the hotel is pet friendly. 3rd location. We were very excited to check into this hotel to get away from the cold weather and ring in the New Year. We were royally disappointed. The hotel is undergoing an extensive renovation. The hotel lobby and common areas were recently redone and are beautiful. The rooms in the north tower were also redone and are nice and comfortable, but I would not say they are anything special. The south tower is currently closed for renovation. The hotel had a wide mix of people from families to people in town for the bowl game and New Years eve to people doing business next door at the convention center. While I felt the hotel was extremely busy, it was not out of control or very loud. After a short $14 cab ride with the most unfriendly cab driver in all of San Diego we arrived at the Marriott Marquis. Our check in was swift and we were in our hotel room with in 10 minutes. We were assigned room 419. a corner room on the 4th floor. Sounded nice, but upon arrival what we found was a very small room, with a tiny bathroom. We made the decision to stay and unpack and go about our day exploring the city. But we ran into problems when we got back. The room was so small we kept bumping into each other. The bathroom was so small that only one person could be in it at a time, which made getting ready extremely time consuming. At the end of the night we noticed the toilet would not stop running which kept waking us up. When we got up the next morning we decided we had to say something, Our rate included breakfast. So we went down to the first floor restaurant and waited to be served. The restaurant can only be described as a mad house. It was over run with families who let their children run wild. The staff was overwhelmed and slow. The hostess forgot to call our name and crossed us off the wait list. After waiting a half hour and noticing people who got their after us were now being seated we said something to the hostess. After saying that she called our name, which she didn’t because I was standing next to her the entire time, she sat us down. We immediately got on line for the omelet bar which was average, but extremely slow. Following our breakfast which took entirely too long, we went to the front desk to complain about the room and service thus far. The woman at reception was nice and apologetic and moved us from our 4th floor room to the 19th floor. Our new room was 1925. What you need to know about the hotel is the north tower is shaped like a football or oval. The largest rooms are towards the center. When you get to either end of the building the rooms get considerably smaller. This was evident from the second we walked into our new room and reinforced by the bellman who helped us move. Room 1925 was right off the elevator and was probably twice the size our original room. It faced the pool and had amazing views of the bay. The bathroom was much larger and had a separate toilet and shower area. It also had a much bigger closet and more drawers for storage. The great part about this room was it faced the bay and had fantastic views of the water and Coronado. We also we had a birds eye view of the Red Bull No Limits jump across the Embarcadero Marina. The service at the Marriott Marquis Marina was lack luster and the employees did not make us feel special being that we are elite members. For the most part we found ourselves frustrated with the service more than usual. There were several small instances, starting with our original room that all added up. One of the biggest was the lack of communication. After spending an entire day out we came back at 4:15pm to find our room was not made up. When I called down to “At Your Service” they said it was because we left our small dog in the room and not in a cage. I understand why they would not enter the room, but we really wished they would had told us that was their policy upfront. They tell you there’s a $75 pet fee up front. How come no one mentioned anything like “The maids will not enter your room for service if your pet is not caged or you are not there”? So that lead to me calling down 3 times for maid service. Each time I was told they were on the way. A maid finally showed up an hour and a half after my first phone call. Another frustration we had was paying for wine glasses. We picked up a bottle of wine along the way and called down for some glasses to enjoy it. The woman who took our request told me there would be a $3 per glass charge since it was a room service request. I find that ridiculous. And I have stayed in many other Marriott’s where there were wine glasses already in the room. Some good parts of the hotel, it’s location is great. It’s on the water. It’s a 5 minute walk to the Gaslamp Quarter. It’s a 2 minute walk to the convention center. The pools are very nice. The gym has been renovated and has all new equipment. One cool thing is you can take a water taxi from the hotel across the bay to Coronado, it’s $6 per person each way. It’s a 15 minute ride across the bay to the Coronado Marriott Resort and Spa. It was a relaxing ride and one of the best days we had in San Diego. I will say the walk from the Marriott in Coronado down to Orange Avenue and then to the beach was 2 miles. So there’s a lot of walking. But if you can do it, walk down to the Hotel del Coronado and have a drink and some food on the deck. You won’t be sorry. Other things about San Diego: Most of the cab drivers were not very friendly. Balbo park is beautiful and worth a trip to see. We had amazing dinners at two restaurants: Bencotto Italian Kitchen in San Diego’s Little Italy. Our second recommendation is Searsucker in the Gaslamp Quarter. Make reservations at both, you won’t be sorry and it will make up for the lack of service at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Halawis
Reviews.Content: A 1 minute walking from the convention center, 5 from the gas lamp quarter. A breathtaking view. Stay at the south tower, much better.

Reviews.Title: “A great quick get away :)”
Reviews.Author: Ksma23
Reviews.Content: Just stayed one night at this property after our company Christmas Party in mid December. I was really so pleasantly surprised with everything the hotel had to offer. If you can be sure to request a marina view with a balcony, as not all rooms have balconies and the marina view is preferable to the downtown view in my opinion. Also, if you plan to check in before 3 or 4 call ahead. We did and our room was ready by 2pm, which was nice because we didn't have to store our bags upon arrival. The hotel has a great ambience, good dining choices nearby (Roy's is a favorite), and the staff is very accommodating. I would really recommend this hotel for business or pleasure, I wish we had gotten the opportunity to stay more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: sambieni
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights over holiday break. The hotel is good, clean, and fairly typical for a Marriot Marquis chain. No real frills, no real drawbacks. The fitness center was excellent. We were initially checked into one room, but found it was still used/unclean with someone's bill and underwear still present. We were quickly relocated to a better room on a higher floor. Management was helpful and efficient. Maybe it was due to holiday weekend, but felt some porters/valet for parking, etc... those small niceties were a bit slower than could have been given the hotel standard. Room was clean. Shower was good. Could have used more towels upon checkin, but were able to get some from hotel floor cleaning attendant. We wanted to have breakfast downstairs in the restaurant, but were told it was a 25-30 minute wait to be seated. We were very frustrated and decided not to wait. It looked like they oculd not handle the number of guests wanting breakfast which seemed really poor planning and/or management. We left and got coffee from nearby cafe instead of waiting. Would have given hotel 4 stars if it were not for this unexpected hiccup. Still, if you need good fitness center, this one is excellent. Next time though, I will check out the Marriott Gaslamp.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: billyclyde
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while on a business trip in December 2011. This is a first rate hotel. The location is great, close to downtown and the airport. It's a short walk to the many restaurant choices in the Gaslamp area, and a 3-mile drive to the airport. The hotel itself is very nice, clean, and in great shape. The fitness center is one of the nicest I have seen, with plenty of machines, weight machines, and a motion room. There is a nice outdoor pool, which I wasn't able to use. The views are superb. If you like to run, you can go out the front entrance and run along nice paths. My room was nice and comfortable. A few negatives: Internet is $13 a day, which is standard for full Marriotts. During my stay, the concierge lounge was closed due to renovation. It would seem like it would be easy enough to set up another concierge lounge while they finish the construction. Parking is $26 a day, even self-parking, which is a bit steep.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis of calm in a sea of activity”
Reviews.Author: jdlWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Wonderful luxury waterfront property with beautiful landscaped, quiet pool area, suitable for a relaxing swim or just reading a book. this hotel is ideally located with easy access to the convention centre, running paths, the quaint boutiques of Seaport Village, the beautiful seawall, many sites to see and museums to visit, the shops of horton Plaza and the restaurants in the Gaslamp. Excellent value for money and a million dollar view to boot from most rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Sweeping views”
Reviews.Author: Hewesema
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriott for two nights prior to taking a cruise. This is a twin town convention hotel located right on the harbor and across from the convention center. But, because there were no conventions in town, the place was empty. We had a lovely harbor view room on the17th floor with a nice little baloney and gorgeous sunsets. The room was newly renovated with all of the Marriott technology, very clean and attractive. Like all Marriotts' a pretty safe choice. Only problem was, because the hotel was so empty, there were limited restaurants and bars open, but that was not a big problem. We plan to stay again when we return from our cruise.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown San Diego”
Reviews.Author: kennergy
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel location. Close to gas lamp quarter. Located directly next to Seaport Village. Hotel has a great pool and very nice pool bar/food. Walking distance to just about any food you could possibly want to eat and many activities are also close by as the marina is directly behind the hotel. The staff was very friendly and the rooms very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laurancn
Reviews.Content: Every time I go to San Diego it's for a convention. This is a great hotel right on the water. The views for the room are beautiful. You see across to Coronado. Sound proofing isn't one of the strengths as you can hear the train whistle at night and if a company has an evening function with music you can hear that. I love the fitness center. State of the art. Has everything that a regular gym would have. It's very big with about 10+ treadmills, 5 ellipticals, 4 bikes, stairclimber. circuit weights, loose weights, 1/2 a "total" gym. Room for floor exercises. Very nice. Open 24 hrs per day so if you're from the east coast & wake up around 3:30 a.m. you can use the gym (and probably won't be by your self). You can walk to the gaslight district for restaurants. Or take a "pedicab" which is fun though a bit expensive. It's right next to the San Diego convention center. Rooms are up to the Marriott standard. Comfortable beds, large screen TV, balcony so you can sit and watch the ships leaving the harbor. Very nice. The hotel was undergoing some renovations so not all the restaurants were open. There is a Starbucks on site. Lobby bar and pool side bar were very active due to the convention.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: Uxbridge
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a weekend in October, and this hotel was superb. The staff were friendly and helpful, and the hotel itself fantastic. Flying in from Phoenix, we arrived at 9am, had asked for an early check-in, and this wasn't a problem at all, our rooms were ready. Centrally located, with the Gaslamp District a short walk, this hotel was in an excellent location. All in all, great and would definitely stay again if we were to take a trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience and a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Robrich890
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times over the years. This is a very nice hotel that is perfectly located. There are so many fun places within walking distance. My favorite place to stay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: pallavik12
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with service. It was a very comfortable and spacious room. The room was facing the sea. the view was breathtaking. the location of the hotel was very convinient. It was very easy to commute to and from places.

Reviews.Title: “Nice updates and views if you like busy”
Reviews.Author: Adrian G
Reviews.Content: The location is great - with marina or city views. The North Tower rooms have balconies. A renovation is underway, changing from the traditional Marriott red and white color scheme to a smart blue and yellow. My room had a shower (no bath) and toilet separated from the sink - which was nice until you realize in the shower that the towels are by the sink! There was plenty of room with all modern conveniences, although the wireless was very patchy, and non-existent in some parts of the room. Usual immaculate, comfortable Marriott bed with ironed sheets (a disappearing trend). The walls seemed somewhat thin or perhaps I just had very noisy neighbors! Be prepared, the hotel is next to the Convention Center, so be prepared for conventioneers and some prolonged wait times. Food was excellent and staff friendly and helpful. Downtown is within walking distance and there is a nice walk along the marina with many shops and restaurants. Prices are at the upper Marriott range but then so is the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “...interesting”
Reviews.Author: pachapeace
Reviews.Content: The view was VERY nice, but the wall was too thin.... We wanted to listen to music after clubbing night, Saturday, we got almost kicked out, because it was too loud....but the volume of the sound was not like outrageous, so, we realized how thin the wall was... So, either you want to enjoy quiet night or party night, I would not recommend. You will be able to hear neighbor's business. Enjoy! ;)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with a View”
Reviews.Author: Allan W
Reviews.Content: Very nice Hotel with a great location. Clean rooms with exceptional views of the Marina and waterway. Concierge service is fantastic, very helpfull! Within walking distance of resturants and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Chino019
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location in downtown San Diego. Staff very helpful..

Reviews.Title: “excellent place 2stay!”
Reviews.Author: pchess12345
Reviews.Content: stayed on the 20th floor, beautiful scenic view of the bay & park below. they just redid their pool area and it is beautiful. lots & lots of room to lay out. & a hot tub. I did not think the hot tub was really that hot. There is a starbucks right by the south elevators - awesome i tell u!! made me very happy to see that! very pretty decorated like you would expect from a marriott. they also give u a little chocolate when you check in - nice.... we ordered room service & got the pizza, it was good. I would recommend it. the room service is open until midnight. the Seaport village is a rocks throw away and an awesome little place to shop & eat. the shops stay open until 9pm but the restaurants stay open longer. the san diego trolley picks up in front of the hotel & also at the seaport village so its super easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, a great value for the area!”
Reviews.Author: jerzdevlk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the San Diego Marriott Marquis and Marina over the Thanksgiving holiday. Our son lives in the neighborhood, but does not have room for guests, so it was convenient to his apartment. When we arrived, tired from travel, we were quickly rejuvenated by checking in to this beautiful, sparkling clean hotel. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the room was beautiful, not to mention the awesome views of both the bay and the city, and the location is perfect. I could step out of the door every morning almost directly onto a wonderful walking/running trail that went on for miles along the waterfront. The room was so clean and quiet, and there were so many great restaurants within walking distance. The hotel had pools and spas that I did not take advantage of, but they looked very nice. There was a Starbucks in the lobby, and we received a free paper each morning. We did have to pay for parking, but the lot was safe and well-lit, so I did not mind that. All in all, it was a wonderful experience, and we will come back whenever we are visiting our son.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: swimmom190
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a gorgeous location, this Marriott is located right on San Diego Bay. It is just a few short steps to the Gaslamp District, a nice stroll to the Embarcadero, a cute village with several shops, a Nordstrom mall, and the Midway carrier. The hotel lobby is sparkling clean and full of helpful staffpersons. The traditional check in desk is broken up into three separate desks, making the lobby look less institutional. The rooms are spacious and clean. My only complaint is that the room service breakfast was so expensive. Any warm breakfast was $16.00 and up, WITHOUT THE COFFEE! That was an additional $10.00. With the room service fee and the 20% tip added on, each breakfast was between $35.00 and $40.00. This was a little stiff.

Reviews.Title: “Atmosphere A / Service strange”
Reviews.Author: 123bag
Reviews.Content: Service was strange! Had service walk in announce three times without knocking and after service for the day was completed. No, was not night service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for conventions”
Reviews.Author: newkindofsoup
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while my wife was at a convention and I have to say the hotel location is the best of local hotels for this purpose being close and accessible to the convention centre and generating a wonderful buzz in the lobby areas while the conference was on. While our room was on the city side it was at the very end closest to the harbour in the north tower and afforded wonderful views of the marina and water. We had some intrusion of noise from the trolley tracks and if we had been on a lower floor and further around on the city side this WOULD have been an issue. At times we also had noise intrusion in the room from other rooms. The staff were generally excellent highlighted by the desk staff on Sunday having no problem arranging late check out the next day as our flight was not leaving until the evening. Unfortunately this was tainted by a poor experience in the lobby bar with very poor service from one of the wait staff moments later when we had a light meal. Another problem I had was the inability to gain internet access in the room at a reasonable price. It does not seem credible that where the internet is ubiquitous and be found for free in lobbies, cafes, shops, parks and other districts that the total cost for internet access for our stay was 20% more than I pay for monthly access in my home. Fitness facilities and the pool area are outstanding features of this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Parents Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Mwar1004
Reviews.Content: I booked a room here for my parents 25th wedding anniversary. The staff was very helpful over the phone and extremely accommodating. My parents loved the room and the view. Beautiful location. They were even treated to champagne and strawberries as a surprise. That impressed me the most.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: rexbo
Reviews.Content: The positive: - great location, - great bed, - great fitness room, - spacious - clean. On the neutral side: be prepared to pay for $26 for self-parking, and $12.95 for Internet in the room (all these are per day). No morning paper, btw. On the not so positive: - everyday there was a bottle of ordinary water in the room. I assumed it was courtesy, until I got the bill ($4 each day).
