Reviews.Content: We used to stay here at least 4-6 times a year for the last 20 + years. Even way back in the days when it was the Inter-Continental. The rooms have terrific views, the staff had been responsive in the past, the food delicious, the hotel sponsored activities wonderful, and the pools delightful. Unfortunately, although we love animals, my family is very allergic to dogs and cats. At our last stay, I did not realize that the hotel decided to allow pets in every room. We had checked in early, gotten our room without a thought, and left for a day of sightseeing. When we returned late in the evening, there were dogs everywhere. The lobby, the bar, the elevators, the wallkways, the hallways, the rooms. I called and asked the front desk if our room or any others were set aside that did not allow pets, as we had allergies, and I was told with rudeness, "NO." As it was late, we went to sleep. In the morning, we noticed animal hair all over the room, as it is hard for the maids to vacuum the bedcovers, chairs, carpeting, etc to rid the room of animal hair. We did have allergic reactions and we will not come back. If you have pets, this is a great place to go. If you have any kind of medical condition to animal dander, you need to avoid this hotel. It was my fault for not asking this hotel about their pet policy. Most pet friendly hotels that we have stayed at either have some rooms set aside that they don't put pets into, or they make a thorough cleaning of the rooms so that those with allergy issues won't be affected. WE DO LOVE ANIMALS,we just have allergies. Unfortunately, when we advised the front desk staff of our problem, they were not helpful in trying to resolve our room issue, not even to offer a thorough vacuuming and cleaning of the room. I guess this hotel is in such demand with pet owners, that they don't care about those without. Pet owners rejoice and enjoy this hotel. It is a good place. Allergy suffers, avoid this hotel at all costs. And let me say again, we do love animals. This is only to warn those with allergies that there are problems here.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased with this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RomewardBound
Reviews.Content: Am currently finishing up a 5 night stay at this hotel for a business conference. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a harbor view with a balcony. The room size is good, the bath area very nice (except I prefer a tub/shower combination and it only has a shower but I forgot to ask at check-in). The staff has been incredibly helpful, particularly the concierge desk. The location is good. We have been journeying out to different areas (La Jolla, San Diego Zoo, etc) and this hotel is a quick hop onto the freeway (Interstate 5). The hotel even runs a water taxi over to Coronado.Didn't notice any renovations going on. The pool is lovely and was quite busy during our stay. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad hotel with poor service... overcharge you at every turn.”
Reviews.Author: TravelDad71
Reviews.Content: 4 Rooms on the first day... no I'm not picky, but this is for real. The first room was directly over the guys jack hammering for the remodel. The second room was literally right in front of the elevator so that every time someone used it, it went "ding". Third room filled with a foul odor when the AC was turned on. Last room was Ok but I spent 6 hours just trying to check in. To top it off... if anyone mails you anything, they charge you $10 to "handle" it. Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent downtown location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerVA51
Reviews.Content: Great location next to the convention center with plenty of restaurants within easy walking distance in the Gas Lamp district and a trolley stop just across the street. Staff shows its experience with the convention/conference crowd. Specific room comments: The curve of the building allows more living area in the room, I had a large size room in the north building with a balcony with views of the bay, airport and downtown; large glass shower with no bath tub; mini-refrigerator in room as a standard feature (Grocery store only 2 blocks away if you want to get supplies); not a big fan of CFL bulbs but room had 4 lamp fixtures so plenty of light available. Minor specific observations: Night light as part of the switch in toilet/shower space - No need to turn on lights during the night to find the bathroom; Shampoo/conditioner bottles that were flat on one side so they lay down easy and not roll off the soap dish.

Reviews.Title: “is sBest hôtel ever !”
Reviews.Author: quebectraveller_8
Reviews.Content: Wow! 1st of all, San-Diego is a beautiful city. And this hotel has it all. It is located in a perfect place on the marina near everything.The view is fantastic ! The beds are so comfortable and the staff was so nice and really helpful. Everybody in San-Diego is great. From the ferry captain to Coronado, the trolley driver and nightclubbers on 5th street. Don't miss: Coronado beach and the Del Coronado hotel, The marina, The clubs on 5th street, Little Italy, Old town, Petco park, Seaport Village, SeaWorld, Balboa park (The Prado restaurant). It cost only 5$ for a daily pass for the train. You can walk a lot around the hotel and the pool is great! I will surely be back with the family someday ! Don't hesitate, book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location!”
Reviews.Author: destinationqueen
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying at this hotel, and I would stay here again if/when I return to San Diego. The hotel is beautifully maintained and updated. Unfortunately while there, the pool was under construction, but from what I could see it looks like it will be beautiful! I was there for a conference, and from what I experienced, the hotel staff was more than accomodating and willing to please. The rooms are very spacious, and if you book a King, expect a California King! We could have easily fit a few more people in the bed and had a party! The bathroom was very modern, spacious and clean. There is a rooftop deck/bar on the 4th Floor - be sure to check it out if you want to soak up some sun or enjoy watching the sunset over the water. The hotel is in a prime location, walking distance to the boardwalk/marina and to the happening Gaslamp District. The only downside: the hotel bars open late on Sundays...

Reviews.Title: “Nice harbor-side location walkable to Gaslamp district, some train noise”
Reviews.Author: beerdrinker2005
Reviews.Content: Even on the 20th floor, rooms overlooking the Convention Center still had obnoxious horn noise from the freight and AMTRAK passenger trains. Hotel staff claim city will someday install modern crossings that will preclude the horn blasts. Nearby Trolley crossings are frequent but not very noisy. Rooms have a mini-fridge and small desk wired Internet. Modern and clean bath. Accessories include an iron, board, alarm clock, hairdryer and safe. Flatscreen TV with A/V inputs, cable channels and movies. Reading desk with small arm chair. King bed with comfortable pillows. Expensive breakfast options. Good draught beers at the lobby bar. Location is walkable to the Gaslamp district and a short taxi ride from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but construction”
Reviews.Author: WorkTraveler18
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very large and the rooms were very nice. The workout facility is awesome, but since there was construction going on, there was no access to the pool, and the front entrance was blocked off. We were dropped off at the alternative entrance which is a million miles from the front desk and with luggage it was not picnic. The staff is very curtious and helpful. The only thing I would recommend, is to put with a water view, not only is it pretty but it will help drown out the sound of the frieght train that runs through the city each night.

Reviews.Title: “Traveling for work conference”
Reviews.Author: Jardila814
Reviews.Content: Got sent for a work conference. Seeing the location, I was excited about the hotel. They were however doing renovations the entire time we were there, even through the weekend. Could hear heavy loud vibrations coming up the walls all day long. You might check if they are still doing remodeling before you stay. The standard room was very small and the bathroom was also. The door swung very close to the toilet and you had to close the door in order to get into the bathtub (at least in my room). However, it was clean. They came in and changed out towels and toiletries each day which not all places bother with. Pros: The conference staff were very attentive. The food for the conference was quite good and they had a nice variety over the two full days we were there. Also, the views were amazing. I overlooked the harbor one way and also the city the other way. Great views! I did pay a small price of hearing a harbor out sound his horn 5 times all three mornings I was there at 4am. That wasn't as fun as I am on eastern time and it felt like 7am to me. :) Also, Seaport Village is a short walk away with lots of dining options and a few cute shops. They had lots of musicians and artists along the sidewalks. Even wondering alone, I did enjoy the atmosphere. Overall - the location is great but it is really just an average hotel. Good location for conferences but don't think I'd stay there on my own.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: gcmanke2
Reviews.Content: I spent the night here after a week in La Jolla. My intention was to get a nice place for one night, close enough to the airport so that I could leave early in the morning. I was very pleasantly surprised by the value, location, and service provided by the Marriot Marina. The view is fantastic and the room was spotless. The location is also a great bonus - Petco Park is just a short 4 block walk away and the famous Gaslamp district is along the way. Transportation to/from the hotel and the airport is extremely convenient. Although the hotel does not have a dedicated shuttle of their own, there are a host of commercial vans that can deliver you to the front door in 15 minutes or less. I took a cab to the airport Friday morning - expect a $15 fare. The pool area appears to be closed for renovation for at least another month or so.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and great locaton”
Reviews.Author: KazariKid
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a conference. My room was free as part of that. I liked the room for the most part, but wish it had had a bathtub. The view was wonderful. The bed had many pillows, which made it easier to sleep, but I found the clock radio to be too bright. I did like to fridge sans minibar. I was able to store some leftovers overnight as a result. The pool area construction was someone disruptive, but I knew about that beforehand, so it was no big deal.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: ladycreole
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 days at this hotel and had a beautiful marina view! Really. I did not have any unpleasant experiences. Everything from the check-in experience to the check-out experience was efficient and professional. The concierge desk was always manned with very knowledgeable, eager staff. I needed information on a couple of occasions and they were very thorough and without delay. There is a Starbucks in the lobby that is convenient for grabbing beverages and pastries/etc. on the go. However, they do close rather early--7pm. There is someone who shines shoes during the day and he is very good and quite pleasant. The gift shop is fairly typical of a hotel in that there are a limited number of drinks, snacks, and over-the-counter items such as pain relievers and toiletries. Parking is $24/day, also typical of a downtown upscale hotel. There is a very nice restaurant called Roy's that is connected to the hotel. The food is considered Hawaiian Fusion. I ate there twice. The food was very good, but beware as some of the items are pricey for the quantity served--ie. the Cioppino. $25.00 for a bowl that had just a small amount of the broth. I did not eat inside the hotel, so I can't speak to the quality. The location is very good. The USS Midway is within walking distance, as is the popular Gaslamp district. Horton Plaza, which is an outdoor mall is about 3 blocks and has a variety of stores, including a CVS drugstore and a few eateries. Nordstrom and Macys are the 2 high end anchor stores. There is a trolley stop just across the street from the hotel. There is a grocery store about 2 blocks away, Ralphs. They carry both conventional and organic products. Their deli wasn't impressive though. I sampled a few items and thought they needed to go back to the drawing board. Other than the deli/items made in the store, I was pleased with the store. Keep in mind, the pool is closed for renovation. They have made arrangements with one of the neighboring hotels for their guests to have pool privileges. Although we didn't use the pool, this was nice to know because often hotels announce the pool is closed and make no concessions or arrangements for the hotel guests. They are doing considerable renovation in this area and it is apparent that it will be simply gorgeous when completed. I believe the target completion is late May, 2011. The hotel is connected to the convention center so there are often a lot of people at the hotel, but don't be put off by that. We never experienced a noise problem or a crowd problem. You can print your boarding pass at the UPS store. This is a nice touch as some hotels do not provide complimentary boarding pass printing. The cleaning staff were attentive and my stay was excellent as I am sure yours will be too!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: amatai
Reviews.Content: The service at this hotel is exemplary, everyone we encountered was genuinely pleasant and helpful. The buffet breakfast was a little pricey, but had a good range. The room was smaller than I had hoped, but very comfortable and with a good view of the bay and Coronado Island. Overall our stay was a very satisfying experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great public spaces and brand new rooms”
Reviews.Author: drivinggirl
Reviews.Content: We were staying at this hotel for a conference in the convention center.The positives: It has just been totally redone.We found the concierge staff and all of the other lobby personnel to be both very helpful and friendly. The gym and lobby in both towers is newly redone, bright and clean. The public spaces are huge filled with stores, coffee, ups etc. We had a north tower room with a tiny terrace overlooking the bay. This was such a nice feature and we even saw a sunset. The very clean, new gym was also great-providing cool wash cloths, apples and water. The pool was not open yet and will be really nice from what we could see through the windows. The negative of this hotel-once you get by the shear enormous size- is that the rooms while redone are very basic as is the bathroom. I would say barely one level up from the newer Marriott Courtyard we stayed in by the airport. The bathroom is very small and the amenities are from Bath and Body Works but no shower gel or cap. The towels are new but kind of scratchy. Our room was not that clean with used contacts on the sink counter and pieces of lollipop stuck to the glass on the night table upon our arrrival (and left for our stay--not the contacts because we threw them out). At various points all night a train with a loud whistle came by and woke us each time (however all of the waterfront hotels were probably affected as well). I am not sure where we would rather have stayed--maybe the Hard Rock because it is smaller and had an open pool or somewhere outside of downtown and commuted--like the Hotel Del Coronado or in La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, gorgeous bay view, but with construction.”
Reviews.Author: tlwSC
Reviews.Content: Great location right next to convention center and very close to Gaslamp District. Big clean rooms. Lovely bay views. Very friendly staff. Be aware that there is a MAJOR remodeling project going on in the pool area, so it can be VEYR noisy during the day (8 am - 5 pm). If you're not going to be in your room during the day, it's not an issue. Otherwise, I recommend you ask for a city-side room. Should be done by summer, and it will be lovely when it's complete.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: CATravel4fun
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel was extremely helpful. We were so impressed with how friendly the entire staff was---we were always greeted with a smile and a warm hello. We had booked a city view room but were pleasantly surprised that we were upgraded to a bay view room on the top floor. The view was magnificent. There was construction going on which made for some minor inconveniences; however, we didn't let any of this bother us. If you want the pool, wait until construction is finished-----the renovated pool area will be lovely. Location of this hotel is great as it is next to Seaport Village and walking distance to Gaslamp District. We were disappointed with Roy's Restaurant. The atmosphere and service were wonderful but our meals were not tasty at all. My husband and I have eaten at Roy's in other locations and have been pleased but our meals at this location were very very blah. Pricey and not memorable at all.

Reviews.Title: “Marriott Staff is Wonderful - Working Hard During Construction”
Reviews.Author: Meenanall
Reviews.Content: Yes, everything is topsy turvy at the Marriott right now. I am sure the pool and common areas will be great when complete. I was put in the rehabbed South Tower with view of Coronado Bridge. My only complaint is that the bathroom door does not stay open so post-shower a little insta-sweat when getting ready. Bed was comfy and had all appointments. I must say their staff provided EXCELLENT care and communication. Really impressed by them as they work with this short term handicap.

Reviews.Title: “Construction on 1/1/2011 - Warning”
Reviews.Author: MeuterMedia
Reviews.Content: Marriott is our favorite place to stay, but major construction was going on on January 1st 2011, what a great day to start the NEW YEAR. Constructions will be going on for MONTHS! Be aware! MeuterMedia Recommend after construction and remodel is finished. Make sure you add the cost for parking to your budget!

Reviews.Title: “Another great Marriott experience, but marred by construction”
Reviews.Author: CardCarrier
Reviews.Content: I am becoming a loyal Marriott customer, due to the really clean rooms, thoughtful furnishings, and comfortable beds and linens that one typically finds as a standard, but this time, I was bit annoyed that we didn't have the hotel at its full capacity. Parts of the hotel and the grounds are undergoing renovations, which we didn't find out until the day we arrived, so fair warning for anyone reading this review. On the other hand, the location near the convention center and other restaurants and shops is ideal for those who like to walk and explore during their trips. (Tip: Listen to the SD natives who kind of look askance when the idea of visiting Old Town is the topic. We didn't take their advice and ended up being seriously underwhelmed by Old Town and its surroundings. Instead, visit Coronado Island if you have a free afternoon during your conference. Those few hours along the beach and walking through the town on a sunny afternoon were the most memorable and pleasant of all during our SD stay.) I would recommend this hotel to friends only after it finishes renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to the convention center/attractions, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AParentGetaway
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while I attended a convention. Many of those attending the convention and staying at another hotel hated the Marriott because the front entrance is being renovated and the pedestrian entrances are not marked very clearly. The hotel was great to me. It was convenient to the convention center and this entrance is still open. There was back stairways that took you to Seaport Village. My room was on the 25th floor in the North Tower. It had a balcony and a beautiful view of the city fully in front and part of the harbor to the left. The room was clean and my only complaint about sleep quality is something that the hotel can't really help --the trolley ringing it's bell at 10:20 pm as it goes by every night (that's 1:20 EST to me). I appreciate the refrigerator in the room and raised an eyebrow to the silver toilet plunger. Now, if the Marriott would only give you free wi-fi like McDonalds, Dunkin Donuts and any other decent place does!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Average”
Reviews.Author: SDRivergirl
Reviews.Content: The location is great and the pool area is amazing. However, the rooms were just ok. I did like the balcony but the hotel itself is very average.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scots4sun
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel but a bit quiet. Would stay in the Gaslamp Quarter next time.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal hotel if you're attending a conference”
Reviews.Author: islandgirl003
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 days to attend my company's annual conference being held at the San Diego Convention Centre. The hotel is perfectly located directly adjacent and is just a very short walk from room to conference. It was so convenient to be able to pop back to my room during conference breaks. There was a Starbucks conveniently located right before you go downstairs to the conference centre which was a plus. I was so impressed with the luxury of my room for the price. We were on the 21st floor in a corner suite with breathtaking panoramic views of the city, pool and marina/ocean. The room was newly renovated and was contemporary, classy and totally posh. The bed and pillows were heavenly. It was spotlessly clean. The pool area had a nice tropical feeling and a generously sized pool. Lots of deck chairs. I only wish I had more time to enjoy it! Right out the back side of the hotel was a lovely waterfront walk with access to dozens of great restaurants. Out the front of the hotel it was a short walk to the Gaslamp district....again, I wish I had more time to enjoy the surroundings. Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. I appreciate the hotels service of splitting the room charges when sharing a room with a colleague so that you can pay for your portion with your own credit card and have your own receipt for tax write offs. Simple but very helpful and appreciated. My only complaints.....we had some challenges with the wireless connection in our room. And when it was time to leave the baggage storage attendants were slightly hostile and took a long time to retrieve our bags. Other than that it was a great place to stay and would totally come again.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxurious with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: flyermontana
Reviews.Content: I agree with those who say this is probably more expensive than it's worth, but I was placed here for a conference and the room was paid for, so I felt very lucky to be in such a plush room. The hotel is divided into the South Tower and the North Tower, and only one of them is newly renovated, so not all the rooms are as nice as mine was. I had an AMAZING view and a beautiful room with such comfortable beds! (If you are a light sleeper, you WON'T like the fact that the loud clanging trolleys go by right outside the window.) But a few things needed improvement: the Internet connection, although expensive, is terribly slow and spotty. The water pressure is not good in the shower, and even the sink faucet didn't work quite right. The cleaning service was a bit careless, not replacing all the towels and leaving me 3 packets of decaf coffee instead of both decaf/regular. The iron didn't heat up properly. However, I loved the location--lots of good restaurants and shopping right in the neighborhood, and even a Ralphs grocery store within a few blocks! The pool is being renovated so no swimming, unfortunately. The staff is extremely courteous and helpful. I wished I didn't have to leave, but I'm glad this wasn't on my bill! (Parking also VERY expensive--$24 per day!)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: cschiefer
Reviews.Content: As participant of a conference, we got special prices ( 40 % off ), but still far too expensive to what you get. Rooms are old, heavily used and crying for renovation. The ice vending machine in our floor was broken for the whole stay ( 4 nights ). The minibar had been removed. There is no free internet available. Not a 4 star hotel ( at least for me ). The only 2 pluses: 1.) Really next to the convention center and 2.) a very nice view to the marina and the harbour.

Reviews.Title: “Slow elevators”
Reviews.Author: perryspires
Reviews.Content: Very slow elevators! Hotel was great, nice views. Close to convention center. Close to marina and sea port village. Walking distance to downtown

Reviews.Title: “Great libation but service is bad”
Reviews.Author: soccergirl123
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent stayed of Marriotts but this hotel is not upmto the marriott standards. You can hear the sirens from the hotel rooms. Rooms are a bit dated and the bathroom door always closes shut. Rooms are on the small size. Good location near the convention center but alwaysna line to eat breakfast and to catch the elevator

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location but too much noise”
Reviews.Author: LynneInMichigan
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this Marriott property. The location is ideal and -- from the right rooms -- the view can be breathtaking. Rooms are spacious and clean. Service is friendly, available and helpful. However, the noise levels are a bit too loud for me. Trains, ship horns, noise from the hall, noise from the connecting room and noise from a hospitality plaza all permeated my sleep. I don't think I had noisy neighbors...I just think the room wasn't as soundproof as some I've been in at similarly appointed hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: jctaz85
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Marriot Marina for a short weeked trip to San Diego. The hotel is situated on the marina near Seaport Village. We stayed in a room with a balcony that had amazing views of the marina, Coronado and downtown San Diego. The room itself was very pretty and tastefully decorated... we felt very comfortable during our stay. Hotel staff was very helpful, especially Roland. He went above and beyond to help my boyfriend and I plan our first night out in the gaslamp district. We went to Croce's, which was great, followed by Syrah. The hotel is in a great location. It is less than a five minute walk to get from the hotel to Seaport Village and the Gaslamp District is also within walking distance. The only issue we came across was when we rented bikes from the hotel to ride to Balboa Park. The chain and pins on my boyfriend's bike came off halfway through a busy intersection. Luckily, he was able to put it back together for the rest of the ride, but it could have been dangerous. When we returned to the hotel we complained about the bikes and found out that the hotel does not handle any of the maintenance. The bikes are provided and maintained by a third-party so riders beware. I would also recommend checking the tire pressure on your bike. The bike rental stand does not provide a pump so we had to test a few before finding two bikes that were OK to ride. The hotel did comp the bike rental fee, which was appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Visited for business, can't wait to go back for leisure”
Reviews.Author: MaryinMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: Though my stay at this hotel was for business, I would gladly come back to this hotel for vacation. The room was spacious and had a great view of the city. It was noisy at night due to the train/trolly right across the street. Lots to do within walking distance and great restaurants on-site. I visited in early October so it wasn't warm enough to swim, but the pool area was gorgeous with waterfalls and a tiki-bar. Great location for conventions or a weekend getaway. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good visit during Comic Con”
Reviews.Author: squifty
Reviews.Content: Mu husband and I stayed here during Comic Con and the location just can't be beat! It is literally right next to the convention center, which makes it so much easier to walk all day and not have to trek back to a hotel far away. While the room was much more expensive than I would like to have paid, it was worth the cost to be so close. They did have a bit of a problem with the service, since my husband had ordered chocolate covered strawberries for me as a surprise in the room after we checked in, however there were no strawberries. He had to go to the front desk and ended up having to tell me and ruin the surprise. They eventually brought them and they were good, but the whole point was to have them as a surprise. The room was comfortable, but typical of the cost for the room. The bathroom was smaller than others for the same price, but tasteful. The food in the bar/restaurant in the hotel was ok, not worth the cost and only decent. The nicer restaurant there was better, but I would recommend reservations for dining there.

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the way”
Reviews.Author: rwbeatty
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the bright stars in Marriott's Crown. Very efficient and friendly staff. Clean room, beautiful views, great location. Definite stay again next time in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “great location, perfect for relaxing”
Reviews.Author: nyspanglish
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a quick getaway with friends during Columbus Day. I have been to San Diego before and wanted to stay closer to the gaslamp district, this hotel was perfect. Everything is within walking distance (shopping, grocery store, fantastic nightlife). The pool was perfect for relaxing during the day and the outside bar was really nice to sit by before getting ready to go out. The restaurant is great, good food and drinks and somewhat reasonable prices. The gym is really amazing and i was sorry i missed out on the yoga classes that are offered. The room was okay-a little dated, but clean and super comfortable bed. My one complaint is that I was charged for parking even though I didn't have a vehicle. I had to call the front desk a couple times to have this charge taken off, which really wasn't a problem. I would definately recommend this hotel and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway!”
Reviews.Author: KillickBoston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a relaxing long weekend before our first child was born. This hotel was perfect for what we wanted; to be able to relax at the pool, a view of the harbour, and close to good restaurants and nightlife. The proximity to the Gaslamp district is AWESOME, and we had no trouble driving to other areas we wanted to see (La Jolla, the zoo, etc). The concierge was very helpful with making restaurant reservations and giving us directions. We spent a day hanging by the pool; I was surprised at how much it felt like a resort. There was a good mix of families (tons of kids in the pool) and singles (who were enjoying the happy hour and pool-side food). We didn't eat at the hotel so I can't comment on that, but there were several restaurants on site that always seemed busy.

Reviews.Title: “Chintzy amenities ruin beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ak20042004
Reviews.Content: The San Diego Marina Marriott has always been one of my favorite hotels. It has an amazing view, beautiful grounds, and has easy walking access to Seaport Village, the Gaslamp District, and generally the best San Diego has to offer. So I was greatly disappointed on my recent "mental health stayover" to find that the hotel has been cheapened by so many cost saving measures that I question whether it even deserves its 4 star rating anymore. Beginning with little things, like no 800 number, no plastic liners in the trashcans, no guest comment cards, $4.00 for a bottle of water, to bigger things--like no free wifi ANYWHERE on the property (at $12.95/day I opted to check out instead). The South Tower has been newly refurbished with the best IKEA has to offer. Hey, I love minimalist Crate and Barrel and Z-Gallerie, but this was no Crate and Barrel!! Cheap lamps, curtains, upholstery; ill-fitting desks. Come On! It's really a shame that such a beautiful property is being turned into a 3-star hotel--not much better than a Residence Inn--by apparently greedy owners. It'll come back to bite!

Reviews.Title: “Be aware of the trains and hidden fees!”
Reviews.Author: Lankam
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three days during a conference. Overall the hotel was fairly new and clean. It was also within close walking distance to downtown gas lamp district and the harbor. The room was spacious and had a beautiful view of the the city. When I first checked in, I was fairly pleased with the properly. On the first night, however, I learned a horrible secret. The hotel is right next to a train crossing. Trains came through every night of my stay at 12:30, 2:00, and 3:30 a.m. The trains blow their usually horns as they cross the road. I did not get any sleep for three days straight. When I complained about the the trains, the front desk clerk said "yes, we know, they were here before we build the hotel." I would never stay in this hotel again. But there are a couple of other things business travelers should know. This hotel charged my company a $225 handling fee for the boxes we had shipped to the hotel for our conference. This was more than it cost to ship the boxes across the country to the hotel. Finally, while having lunch at the DW grill on site, my table received dirty dishes on two different occasions. The waitress indicated when she brought us spare plates that were dirty "ooopps, must have grabbed them from the dirty pile." YUK!

Reviews.Title: “Location is the best part.”
Reviews.Author: handpickd
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights while attending an event at the Convention Center. The location was wonderful. My room was on the 12th floor with a beautiful harbor view. When you go out the back of the hotel, you are on a beautiful walkway that takes you to Seaport Village or Embarcadero Park. The North Side Park had a car show and various street vendors on the weekend. It was a great area for walking. The park on the South has exercise stations along the way. When you go out the front door, it is an easy walk to the Gaslamp District and Horton Plaza. It is adjacent to the Convention Center and the morning it was raining, they had a clearly marked path through the parking garage to the Convention Center so you didn't have to go outside. Unfortunately, part of the walkpath was underwater and you had to splash through puddles. The restaurants were pricey but the food was very good. I also attened a conference dinner in the ballroom that had very good food for that type of event. I ate breakfast there twice and they have a (pricey) buffett which I passed on. It took longer than it should have when I placed an order. They are definitely trying to get you to stick with the buffet. I also ordered a room service breakfast my last morning and it failed to have the fruit with it that should have been included. There are a ton of other restaurants within walking distance. The TV was old and the picture quality no what we are used to anymore. It had limited channel selections with little of interest. It does have 1 HBO channel. There were times I had to wait quite a while for an elevator. They really need to restrict elevators to certain floor levels to eliminate the time and capacity issues. The pool looked very nice but the weather wasn't good enough for me to use it. The concierge was very helpful with advice. The front desk check in process was very slow. When I checked in, there was only one person working and another trying to but unable to get a computer to log in while there was a long line of weary travelers. When I arrived, I took the Super Shuttle from the airport. I knew the Marriott was only a few minutes away so I didn't see the need for a taxi. The shuttle took ridiculously long with the driver calling in with the locations he was going to so they could set his trip computer and every person getting off before me paying by credit card. The shuttle was $8, a taxi was $12. The taxi would have been much faster and simpler. The Marriott has a dedicated shuttle but its not clear on the web site. I took that one back to the airport and it was fast and pleasant. It leaves every half hour and only costs $6 per person.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: JCandCarleen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here before and after cruising on the Royal Caribbean into Mexico. The rates were very competitive, location great for our cruising vacation. We live in Tucson, so driving or flying to San Diego is easy. Breakfast was included, was acceptable, and there was plenty. Front desk staff was helpful, and we would stay there again. Also lots of very good restaurants within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for downtown activities”
Reviews.Author: chisox05
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights with my wife and teenage son. Very nice room in the renovated South Tower. Even though we booked this room at a bargain through Priceline it still had a partial harbor view from the 17th floor. We could see the Coronado bridge and the Gaslamp District. We didn't spend much time on the hotel property. Didn't even check out the pool, but it looks great. Easy walk to the trolley, the lively Gaslamp nightlife, Seaport Village, Petco Park and the convention center. We didn't have any trouble parking, but I believe previous reviews that it could fill up on a busy evening. We thought about returning our car a day early to save on parking, but found out that their airport shuttle costs $6/person.

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal convention hotel in a very good location”
Reviews.Author: KailuaKween
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this place was what it cost me on Priceline. I paid $100 at the last minute for a 4 star hotel. The place is located about 2 blocks from the Gaslamp Quarter. I felt comfortable walking there at night with my daughter. Our room had a partial harbor view and comfortable beds. Nice pool area, where we ate our breakfast from the buffet just inside the North Tower. Dislikes: Check-in felt like a cattle call. The desk clerk's behavior fell somewhere between 'cold' and 'cordial,' with the emphasis on getting to the next person in line. Our room had a place for a mini-bar, but the cabinet was empty. Question: Why do you need a stainless steel plunger in the bathroom? Answer: because the toilet is subject to back- ups.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: CLMG
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The south tower has been renovated and is very nice, clean and up-to-date. Would highly recommend this hotel and would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Simply great.”
Reviews.Author: Nicolas_Simard
Reviews.Content: Great location in beautiful San Diego. Walking distance from all the sweetspot in town. Close to the airport. Bit pricey but you gotta enjoy every second of your stay. Be sure to close the window of the patio door when you go to bed... the city train is kind of disturbing in the middle of the night. Don't miss the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Courtesy and Service Ever”
Reviews.Author: Moltenled
Reviews.Content: We chose San Diego Marriott at the Marina cuz' we wanted to have a good view of SD Harbor and a balcony. We requested specifically the balcony, the view, and asked that a refrigerator and microwave be put in our room. We arrived around 3 p.m. and were fortunate to be able to walk right up to the desk. Our room was ready and waiting and immediately upon entering our room, they brought the requested refrigerator and microwave. Everyone was as nice as they could be, from the workmen occasionally encountered in the hallways to the people at the front desk.. We have rarely encountered such continual and complete courtesy and graciousness in a hotel this size. We had a beautiful view of the Bay and a nice patio. The room was in the North Tower and was a tiny bit dated in decoration, but not at all "shabby" or "rundown." The South Tower, which is newer, does not have balconies. The room was very nice however and we had no complaints with it whatsoever. The pool area is large, lovely and tropical - a wonderful place to relax with a book. The location is great. You are right on the Bay, the Midway Aircraft Carrier and Seapoint Village are just a few steps away. The Gaslamp district is just a few blocks away and there are jogging paths all over the area. The Old Town Trolley, a fun tour experience, stops right in front of the hotel. This is not an inexpensive hotel, and parking is an additional $24 self park, and $34 valet parking, but we felt we definitely got our money's worth. They have Roy's Hawaiian Fusion Restaurant on the premises and while it is also expensive, it is quite good and the restaurant staff goes out of their way to make it a pleasant dining experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with convenient location”
Reviews.Author: travelgal63
Reviews.Content: First time stay at this hotel. Had a room in South Tower on 25th floor. Room was quite spacious as was the bathroom. Quick walk to Gaslamp, Petco Park, Horton Plaza. Nice view of Coronado and Point Loma. Beds very comfy but you do hear the train whistles in the night through no fault of hotel. Parking can be tight. I must comment laundry service. Attended concert at the Embarcadero where a woman spilled red wine on my cashmere sweater/linen pants. The in-house laundry was able to get ALL stains out! Fabulous!! Would stay again. LOVE Roy's Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Optimal location for Convention & Gaslamp Quarter, great views, solid hotel.”
Reviews.Author: drmikenyc
Reviews.Content: I am sure there are many other detailed reviews which will describe the parking & reception experiences, rooms, and location. So I'll be brief and try to hit the key points for me, during this mid-August 2010 stay. First, location, location... This is tough to beat, especially for a Convention Center event. This hotel is literally next door to the SDCC, requiring merely a walk down the steep entrance way, past lovely flowers and facing the trolley tracks and Gaslamp District, and a short walk (~ 1 city block) to the A-side of the huge convention hall). If distance is critical (limited walking, accessibility, etc.), the South Tower is slightly closer. The hotel, as I read "here" before booking, has 2 Towers, and both are fine, straddling a huge pool and the lovely marina which adjoins Seaport Village (great sunsets and several "artsy" shops, fresh cookies, seafood restaurants, fireworks on weekends, horse 'n buggy rides, nice place to stroll). The North Tower has many rooms with small balconies, a major appeal to me, and reason I requested this. Savvy travelers have described how the South Tower has more modern amenities (e.g., large LCD TV's) which may be true, but it has few balconies and I was happy with my room's old but empty refrigerator (to stow a sandwich for next day or milk/beverages) rather than overstuffed "refreshment bar" one needs to dance around to fit a stick of cheese, or risk paying exorbitant prices for. Only one bottle of spring water to fit that bill, and there's a small store with early/late hours in the lobby between the two towers, selling sundries, snacks, even liquor, along with post cards etc. So it's easy to live close to the room and hotel and do a lot of eating out, as well as storing some food & drink for snacks and packing for day trips. (Did I mention the San Diego Zoo? I will!) I was solo and there for a professional conference so mostly work-oriented, and the convention center proximity was ideal to lug things back and forth. Like many huge convention hotels, the wait for the elevator around dinner time could be fierce, but what can be done? ;-) Parking lot got full which might be annoying to some, but then there was valet parking. I'm sure expensive, but that's typical too. I used cabs or public transportation, both easy. Doormen/concierge - all cheery, helpful, hard-working, quick to pull out maps and share personal knowledge of the area. Gaslamp Quarter is "just across the tracks" literally (well, down the ramp, across the trolley tracks, and 2-3 blocks South to the heart of it, the entrance being at 5th Ave). A 10 minute walk to the bus and 1/2 hour ride and I was at the Zoo on my one day off. It's as good as it's reputation. Allow a full day! Other than location, amenities were fine for me, maybe not as decadent as some might expect from a 4/5 star place, but the balcony view of the Marina and Coronado Island made up for that! (Same with the not-state-of-the-art TV which I could not plug my computer into, but that was ok, and was "forced" to take my little laptop screen out to the balcony to look at my zoo photos with.) My bed was King, and comfortable, with a massive collection of pillows. Maids when I saw them (my way out) were friendly, one taking pride that her photo was on the desk - "that's me!". Always clean, unobtrusive (left my work materials alone, put away the excess pillows, replaced glasses, etc.) Compared to some conference hotels, the pool and marina really screamed "resort!" and were both pretty to see and lovely to visit. There's a poolside bar some enjoyed plus several restaurants, lounges, and conference-related hospitality suites and a lounge. The Hawaiian Fusion restaurant, Roy's, sits atop the pool area and its lower floor opens up to tables on the "boardwalk" along the marina, another good place to catch a sunset. Bath amenities: ok. Desk: nice. (Bring your own broadband or prepare to pay for it, like most US convention hotels.) Balcony: great. (Mine had two chairs, no table, but was a great place to think, reflect, even try to do some work). Only did room service once - and it was quick (and as is common, expensive after the various delivery and service fees - but still I enjoyed the breakfast I had one morning). I didn't really get a chance to see specifically child/teen/family friendly things, other than the pool (and of course the ease of seeing sightseeing musts like the Zoo and Sea World, etc.) Really oriented towards Convention crowds, but when the crowds thin it must still be a nice place to lounge at the pool, explore the Gaslamp Quarter and elsewhere by night, and use as a base for seeing San Diego. I didn't have much leisure time within the hotel itself, as it was my convention base camp, but staff were responsive and friendly, and did I mention the location? I'd love to return to SD, and would have no qualms about staying here again if I needed to be right at the Convention Center, or nearby. If I had one pet peeve, it was the neighbor who seemed to be studying anvil and pickax use early morning and late night. Paper thin wall, at least with a connecting room, which I should have had the presence of mind to avoid, but forgot. Still, I had such a great view and room overall, two earplugs and a wake-up call took care of that.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool and location but expensive parking and other things”
Reviews.Author: AZGuy85255
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed at the Marriott Mariner prior to a Deep Sea fishing trip. We were hoping to be able to see a game at Petco park but the Padres were out of town. The location is on the water and close to the Gas Lamp district. It is an easy walk or an expensive Pedicabs. Seriously, $40 to go 3 blocks? The Pool area is more of a resort pool than a convention hotel pool. It is nice to be able to run along the water in the mornings. If you get a view of the water, you get to see the Navy ships in the bay. I would say the biggest con would be parking. $24 for self parking. $35 for Valet. Even though self parking is suppose to be on the property, we had to park like 3 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel .... EXPENSIVE FOOD & PARKING! READ OUR TIPS”
Reviews.Author: KRochelle
Reviews.Content: I recently spent three nights at the Marriott Marina San Diego with my bf. for my birthday. It was lovely. We would stay there again but read on for important pointers if you are trying to save money. The good: The hotel is decorated beautifully and has a friendly staff. The rooms are clean. We stayed in the North tower and while some reviews have said that it is more dated than the South tower, we still found that the decor was lovely and the beds more comfortable than any we'd slept in. While expensive, the food at the restaurants is delicious. Roy's was a wonderful early dinner by the water for two tired travelers but expect to pay top price. The landscaping is gorgeous. The pool area is like walking into your own personal tropical paradise. The hotel is a short walk to many downtown locations and we enjoyed a morning jog on the docks through Seaport Village (which also hosts several wonderful restaurants and fun shops.) *The hotel has an EXCELLENT fitness center (and they have free apples there) The bad: Prepare to pay $24 daily to park your car IF...and that is IF they have a spot available for you. THey provide parking for the marina as well and when we returned from a day at the San Diego Zoo we couldn't find parking anywhere and were told that we could valet for $35. The parking is inadequate for the size of the hotel. All of the restaurants are expensive. Even the Starbucks in the lobby is almost twice the normal price. Breakfast was overpriced. We split ONE omelet with a side of fruit and had two coffees and one juice and the bill was $35. FOR BREAKFAST w/ only ONE entree. TIPS: Stay here. The view is great. The location is fantastic. Walk two blocks to Richard Walker's Pancake House for incredible oversized breakfasts. (ONE omelet filled an entire dinner sized plate and we gladly split one AND had pancakes and beverages for $17... 2 people.) They beat the hotel's breakfast by far on taste and price. Venture off of the property for food if you are on a budget. Downtown San Diego is awesome and the Marriott is situated where you can walk anywhere. If we stay here again we won't bother renting a car. Hope this helped :)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic views, comfortable rooms, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: K_A_R-1775
Reviews.Content: High points: large and scenic heated pool, large rooms, courteous and attentive service. Great location near light rail, shopping, gaslamp district. Low points: Can be hard to find an open parking space on weekend nights. Recommendations: Go to Richard Walker's Pancake House (one block away) for an amazing breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “irritating in little ways that add up”
Reviews.Author: cmshields
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the North Tower for the California Bar Exam. The most worrying aspect of my stay was a locked emergency stairwell. The elevators are currently being refurbished, so the wait was quite long at times. Being on the third floor, I got tired of waiting one day and decided to take the stairs down to the lobby. The stairwell closest to the elevator (and the designated evacuation route for the rooms on that side of the tower) ended in a locked door- there was literally no other door to get out between the locked bottom door and third floor. Glad there wasn't a fire! The North Tower rooms are aged and a bit shabby. The bed, however, was extremely comfortable. A mini-fridge would have been useful, instead of the empty cabinet where one would normally be. Rooms are also noisy- sound echoes in the halls, and there is a large gap under each door, so you hear everything in the halls. Earplugs were necessary for sleeping. Parking during Padres games is an issue. At $24 per day to self-park, I didn't even try to valet the car. Be forewarned, the hotel sells parking to folks attending ball games at Petco Park, so if you are attempting to return to the hotel around the time a game is starting, there may be no parking. Parking structure for the North Tower is creepy, dark and drippy from leaking pipes. The whole approach to the North Tower from self-parking is weird- you feel like you're in parts of the property that are normally hidden away from guests (stacks of stored chairs outside the tower, trash area, etc). The Starbucks on site is convenient, but they charge double what a Starbucks normally charges. Gulp! Reservation agents were pleasant but a bit hapless. The hotel had a special rate of $149 a night for the Bar Exam. They had mis-booked my reservation and goofed up my email address, so I phoned them to confirm my reservation and find out why I hadn't received an email confirmation, I learned that I had been booked for a stay that was one night shorter than I had requested at booking. The agent didn't even apologize or offer anything to try to fix it. I ended up having to pay the rack rate of $199 for one night. Some sort of apology or recognition that they had screwed up by getting the check out date wrong and failing to send the confirmation email would have been appreciate. The "high speed" ethernet consisted of a modem which felt like it was overheating. Noticed that it was actually just a phone line (not an ethernet cable) that came out of the wall and into the modem. At $12.95, it seemed way too questionable, so I opted not to use it. Is it really too much to ask to expect decent Wi-Fi in my room? The "express checkout" on the TV (as per the instructions slipped under my door on checkout morning) was actually non-existent. Grrr. All in all, there were plenty of little irritations that would prevent me from ever recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Completely Happy with our Stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2laughnetime
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fabulous...everything from the service to the location. We stayed 6 nights and had zero issues. The staff was professional and friendly. The accommodations were perfect for us. As far as location, we were convenient to all the places we visited. They do have a $24 per day parking fee, so we opted not to rent a car and take cabs. The most expensive cab ride was to Sea World at around $24.00 each way...We also went to the zoo and that was only $15 each way. We walked everywhere else...including Petco park to catch a few baseball games. I would be remiss if I didn't mention that you can occasionally hear a train go by...This really didn't bother us at all as I only noticed it a few times during our stay. All and all, I highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very pricey, great location, some "technical difficulties"...”
Reviews.Author: Graciepop
Reviews.Content: Ok so for the four days of Comic Con we were charged nearly $400 a night which is pretty outrageous but I wanted a hotel close to everything and didnt want to go through the COmic Con lottery for hotels so I booked back in October of 09 for our stay in July 2010... Service I experienced while staying at the Marriott was top notch guys, our toilet started overflowing everywhere one morning and maintenance were at our room in minutes (considering the size of the hotel thats quick).. ordered room service a couple of times and it was great.. very friendly staff in gift shop/at Starbucks/at reception/ restaurant cannot speak more highly of them.. I would recommend staying in the South Tower as it is the newer of the two and although room do not have balconies, air con works perfectly without drying out the air.. Had a huge TV in the room (approx 32-38 inch screen) and a fridge for storing goodies! Favourite part of the hotel has to be the beds my lord they were SO COMFY, least favourite part was the highly overpriced breakfast buffet and nearly breaking my ankle on an uncleaned spill in the elevator one morning... If you like homey boutique hotels then stay away, this is a huge place resembling a Las Vegas superstructure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location... That's About it!”
Reviews.Author: izzamracop
Reviews.Content: Maybe my expectations were wrong as very disappointment with selecting this Marriott as the hotel for my family vacation. Location is great, however everything else falls way short for a Marriott of this level. I'm an awards member and stay at Marriott a lot and have never written a bad review on any other properties. Service here is definitely lacking across all departments. Maybe it's the SD air but it's definitely obvious. Check in not good as reservation was wrong, had $60 credit per day but main restaurant closed and can't use at Roys or other Marriott's, hotel shows waterslide at pool, however it was shut down and looks like they don't use, rooms outdated (going under refurbishment) which is ok if good service or rooms clean (mold in bathroom, couple fixtures falling apart), Irish Restaurant service and food poor. If the service by staff was more friendly and accomodating I think I wouldn't be writing this review. Not a Marriott I would suggest staying, even if you are attending a convention. Try the Marriott Coronado (just across the water) or Gaslamp which is just down the street as you can still use the pool here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kscruiser
Reviews.Content: This hotel made a great place to base ourselves during the Comic Con activities. We stayed in one of the renovated rooms on the bayside of the South Tower. Awesome view of the bay. Had no trouble with the elevator wait times despite it being crammed packed full of people. Rooms were quiet except during one episode when the people next door to us must have been having a brawl of some sort at 0445 in the morning, but security was there almost instantanously and it became very queit again. Did not eat at any of the restrauants in the hotel as we were kept to busy at the con. Very close to the gaslamp district and other attractions. Didn't need a car at all, used taxis to get to the zoo and took the trolley tour to see other sites of the city.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VIEW, GREAT LOCATION, TOO EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: QueenSandy
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the good. With 200,000 people converging on one location for Comic-Con, I think the Marriott staff did a bang up job. We were checked in hours early and they were polite, efficient, and even, dare I say, cheerful, when it had to be a very stressful time for them. The rest of the staff was just as friendly, helpful and polite from the maid to the valet to the concierge. The view from the north tower balcony room we were given could not have been more beautiful (see pictures) and it was nice to sit outside after the hectic convention each day. The location was also the very best possible if you are going to any function at the San Diego Convention Center. The convention center is practically connected to the Marriott through the parking garage or a quick walk down the sidewalk. On Friday and Saturday night there was a fireworks show over the bay, but I don't know if that's a weekly thing. It was a treat for me! I was a little concerned about all the complaints from other posters about the train noises, but I never noticed them at all. There was also some concern about the wait for elevators. Granted, a line would form after a big event let out, but I never waited more than a few minutes. Everyone there understood the situation and just dealt with it. The only complaint *I* have is the price. I understand Comic-Con is a godsend for the tourist industry in San Diego, and I also understand the concept of charging whatever the market will bear (after all....I paid the price, right?) but seriously, $450 a night (non-refundable) for a simple room with no extra amenities besides a 2-cup coffeemaker? Plus $34/day for parking and $12/day for internet service? That's almost $500 per day for a room that would never get half that if it were anywhere else at any other time. This is definitely a case of location, location, location. I would gladly go back there another time but I will never pay such a high price again.

Reviews.Title: “Another overpriced, underwhelming Marriott”
Reviews.Author: Marcello74
Reviews.Content: First of all, the hotel is truly in a a great location -- on the marina, next to the convention centre and Gaslamp Districts. If you want to be near the action, this is the place to be. That said, this property is typical of Marriott properties elsewhere. Overpriced, slightly over confident, and very underwhelming. My king room was clean and bright, and the balcony was a nice space-addition, even though it was tiny -- just being able to open the patio door made my room bigger. Unfortunately, the tv is a tiny 22" CRT. The mini-bar cupboard contained no fridge. And the $12.95 per day internet connection was useless -- a wired connection, it cut in and out worse than any wireless I've ever had. Staff in the hotel were ambivalent but not cold. My room was well-tended and I never felt rushed by housekeeping staff. Only on checkout did I experience a frosty staff person -- grunting his way through my checkout, he at least comped me two nights of internet hookup. Just neglected to talk to me at all through the entire process. Pricing in restaurants/room service were typically high for Marriott properties. Food is very good, however. Fitness centre is enormous and modern. The resort-like pool area is highly popular and cramped, though staff are quick to tend to your needs. Just beware the $11 drinks from the Tiki Bar. Poolside menu is promising but the food was below average. Other restaurants were limited in terms of hours -- even the onsite Starbucks is closed by early evening. All in all, yet another Marriott property that defies the distinction of the brand, and instead just exemplifies mediocrity. Even as an elite guest, I'm still not sure what the fuss is with Marriott hotels. This was a fine hotel. Just not sure it was worth $290 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with easy access to downtown and waterfront”
Reviews.Author: sylvieinwindsor
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable time at this hotel recently. I had arrived in San Diego at 10:30 AM and was worried that check-in was not until 4pm, but I went to the hotel anyway and they cheerfully gave me a room right away without any problem. The room was in the NORTH tower on the 24th floor (out of 25) and had a beautiful view of the harbour and the city and the incredible san diego sunsets. i had read that the north tower rooms were outdated but our room was quite nice and very clean and had a balcony with 2 chairs and a little table. we spent most of our "room time" out there. the room itself was very quiet and we didn't notice any street noise or other guests. ofcourse, you couldn't block out the ridiculously loud horn of the freight train that rolls through in the evening but i'm sure they were hearing that in mexico. the pool area is beautiful and i had no trouble finding a nice lounge chair by the water during the week, but on the weekend, the place goes crazy and you have to sit up on the lawn, a surprising distance from the action. but the bar service is still good up there and the pool is filled with screaming kids anyway. the location is perfect for walking around downtown or along the harbour and seaport village or catching the mariott water ferry across to coronado.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again... :-(”
Reviews.Author: ridenslide
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our honeymoon 20 yrs ago and were anxious to return. All I can say is it was the worst experience I have had at any hotel in years. The valet service ($34.00 per night, robbery) was awful. On a Sunday morning at 7:15AM, it took 25 minutes to get my car. The room was clean but the A/C did not work so the temp in the room felt like 80 degrees. They allow dogs in the hotel and lucky us had one barking down the hall all night long. Not even going to get into the problems with the elevators. Suffice to say we had to use the Service Elevator on Sunday to get down to the lobby. The pool had enough chlorine to kill fish. One good thing...the service at the pool was outstanding, even though there was not even an empty lounge chair. Those girls work their butts off and do an awesome job. I would never stay here again and never recommend this hotel to anyone. Especially for the rate charged. Everything is overpriced. My daughter and niece ordered 2 orders of Chocolate Chip cookies and ONE glass of milk from room service. $24.00. 'Nuff said. I was incredibly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Kangaman
Reviews.Content: What a delightful hotel. The room was small but so well designed, with a balcony that added a lot of space and a superb view of the ocean and Coronado Island. I can only speak of this hotel, the staff and the service in superlative terms. There was nothing I could find to criticize. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JadepearlToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights for a convention. All the amenities of a quality busines hotel, with good service for 2 large conventions happening the same week. Oddly, I was assigned a room on the 26th floor, problem, none of the elevators went to the 26th floor, trust me I checked them all. I finally went back to the desk and no one had told me that you go up to the 25th and then climb a flight of stairs. They changed my room. I stayed in the South Tower on th e21st floor overlooking the city. Bed was great and no noice in or outside of the hotel, very peaceful. Service was very friendly and good. Didn't use but the pool area looked beautiful. Yes, the elevators get slow and crowded, it's a big hotel and I've had this experience in others as well. Location is great, a short walk to a nice mall (includes a Norstrom and Maceys) up the street for some quick shopping and also to the Gaslamp area for good dining.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: finewineNJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Marriott Marina for a convention. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful. I stayed in the South Tower overlooking the city. Very nice, recently renovated room with a nice, modern bathroom, comfy beds, refrigerator and widescreen TV. Everything was very clean, and maid service was excellent. Except for the trains (see below), I found the hotel to be very quiet. It is attached to the convention center and is very convenient to the Gaslamp District and Petco Park. The pool is excellent, with a lot of seating and clean pools. However, there are some significant downsides to this hotel. The biggest is the elevators. Although they are renovating them, I had long waits at all times of the day. Be prepared to squeeze into them with a lot of other guests. The train noise (at least on the city side) is almost unbearable. I had to wear ear plugs just to drown out the loud train whistles in the middle of the night. Lastly, stay away from the DW restaurant. The service is the worst I've ever experienced (and I told them so). There are much better places to eat within steps of the hotel. Although I would really like to recommend this hotel, the cons outweighed the pros. There are at least a dozen other hotels close to the convention center with similar amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - this is a convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: sajdrk
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews and thought this would be a good choice for the long 4th of July weekend. Unless you are at a convention, I would stay away from this hotel! Compared to other Marriotts, e.g., JWs, this has few amenities, very slow crowded elevators, marginal service. The rooms don't even have wine glasses or body wash! We are Platinum members so have a lot of experience with Marriotts. Will not stay here again (unless, of course, I'm going to a convention).

Reviews.Title: “Usual Marriott experience in a great location”
Reviews.Author: aber_james
Reviews.Content: Superbly set hotel, convenient for San Diego Convention Center and the Gaslamp District. Rooms were large and clean; mine overlooked the marina despite being 'city-side' - and it was nice to have a balcony. The passing trains are a bit of a nuisance at night, especially if a light sleeper, and the walls are a tad thin. No fridge. Shame about the lack of WiFi.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and several Ammenities”
Reviews.Author: Alaskanwhites
Reviews.Content: Even though the weather did not cooperate while I was here, the hotel was fabulous. Restaurants were very good and the hotel had everything I hoped it would have. Everything is within a few blocks away, even a grocery store.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, hotel”
Reviews.Author: basildogpuppy
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, close to gas lamp district, the beautiful marina, three miles from the airport, on the train line, close to the freeways. The pool was beautiful and heated, the workout room was state of the art, clean, offered aerobics classes, and is open 24/7 !!! The staff is amazing helpful nice and courteous. The rooms, where nice and had balconies everything was excellent!!!!!!!!- The only thing that could have been better would be to have better noise canceling rooms, sometimes it was rather loud in our room. We often could hear the train signals and horns all night.

Reviews.Title: “Had Higher Expectations”
Reviews.Author: RnR_3
Reviews.Content: I traveled on business with the government where this hotel came recommended. The recommendation must have come from a business partnership because I found the following problems: - A/C was stuck on at 70 degrees until maintence fixed it - Mattress was worn and obviosly not turned because I was stuck into what felt like a sink hole. - Carpet within the hotel room had lumps of ?? underneath. - Ceiling had new water marks - Had to pay for parking no matter if you parked yourself or used the valet - Internet had a daily fee - Every night you could hear children & adults throughout the hall. Overall, for the high price paid I feld the accomodations were average at best and there wasn't even a continential breakfast or free wi-fi available to make it worth it. I'm heading back out in a few weeks and will be staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in San Diego - loved location on hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ebk1174
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Diego for 4 days and loved this hotel. I used Priceline for our San Diego hotel and rec'd the Marriot Marina for $70/night....great price. Although parking is $24/night extra, it seems to be the norm with San Diego hotels. We were given room 1940 in the South Tower which was a corner room - we had views of the city and marina with 2 complete walls of windows. The room was updated with VERY comfy beds and linens, flat screen TV, beautiful bathroom, etc. The hotel is in walking distance of the gaslamp quarter with all the restaurants and Seaport village, we loved both places. It was about 15 minutes driving time from Seaworld and 40 minutes to Legloand. We used the hotel pool and had lunch at the pool, prices were very reasonable and service was great. Overall, we really enjoyed this hotel and would stay here again if the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “Just remodeled. Rooms are clean and...”
Reviews.Author: soccergirl123
Reviews.Content: Just remodeled. Rooms are clean and spacious. Fantastic gym. Only problem is the gym is located near the resturant so the smells of food make you hungry when you are working out!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but also not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreFrancophile
Reviews.Content: Rooms are okay but nothing special. The ceiling in my colleague's room had patches where the paint had chipped away or fallen off. To their credit, the front desk offered to switch her to another room, but honestly this should never have been allowed to happen in the first place. When a place charges $200+ a night the rooms should be well-maintained and in good repair to begin with. I also wanted to order breakfast via room service for the next morning but there was no order form in my room (you make your selections and hang the form on the outside door handle the night before). It was late and I called down to get a form and had to wait almost a hour to have it brought up to me (it was late and I had an early meeting the next day and wanted to go to bed).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Option for Petco / Conventions”
Reviews.Author: Wiscomm
Reviews.Content: We were in town to catch a few games at nearby Petco Park. We choose the Marriott because of it's excellent access to Gaslamp, Seaport Village, Petco Park and most importantly the views of the bay front. The property is directly adjacent (dare I say the closest property) to the San Diego Convention Center. This is the place you want to stay if you are in town for a show or convention. We sprung for the $25/night upgrade to the SOUTH TOWER (newly renovated) with a Bayview. We were already using a Friends & Family Rate and the front desk staff had no problems giving us a nice upgrade even with our discounted rate. The newly remodeled rooms are very nice, includes the upgraded Marriott beds, LG flat panel TV (No HDTV signal though) and over-sized walk-in showers. We did not see the NORTH TOWER rooms so we cannot speak for how bad they are. The room was very clean, nothing caught my eye as unclean (we are freaks when it comes to this). We did notice some noise from adjoining rooms and through the bathroom walls. All of the public areas on the property appear recently updated and were all in excellent condition. All staff we had encounters with were excellent, the front desk and the doormen stood out as very friendly and accommodating. The pool area is abundant with plenty of seating. We would have liked to see the adjacent seating areas gas "firepits" working as we had a few chilly nights, that would have been a nice touch. As mentioned above the property is in a excellent location to the numerous restaurants and attractions. The watertaxi to Coronado and the SeaPort Village is less then a 5-minute walk using the adjacent boardwalk. PETCO PARK - While there are many other hotels closer to the Park, none are located on the water. The park is very easy 10-15 minute through the promenade and streets of Gaslamp. The area appears very safe, however we did notice a number of homeless in the area if that bothers you. Overall we were quite pleased with the property, it does seem that property is priced about $100/night more then it should be. We would stay here again when we visit "America's Finest City" again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: designbaby
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, great amenities, outstanding customer service, and an unbeatable location. We were given an end room in the South Tower with AMAZING Marina views from two sides. There are only two of this type of room per floor so my husband and I got extra lucky! (NOTE: The North Tower faces the train tracks and is about to undergo renovation, so make sure you ask for the South Tower when booking.) The hotel loses points for scratchy towels, overpriced wifi, and a loud mini fridge which we had to unplug to sleep properly. But the overall experience was a definite thumbs up. Would highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View of the Bay”
Reviews.Author: kenny111111111
Reviews.Content: This was a beautiful hotel close to everything and had an amazing view of the bay and Coronado Island. Very clean and friendly staff. Only drawback is that you can hear the train go by all night.

Reviews.Title: “fraudulent charges to room”
Reviews.Author: mrmccoon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is convenient to Gas Light district and sites along the harbor Room was excellent, but noisy if you are on city side rather than harbor side Nearly $100 of fraudulent charges were billed to my hotel room, for among other things, parking in the hotel garage when I did not have a car. There are much better places to stay in San Diego that have much more helpful and friendly staffs

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Views from this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpmorg
Reviews.Content: Loved the Marriott at the Marina. The rooms with the views of the bay were amazing! Views of the Coronoda Bridge and Island, the bay, Point Loma, the ocean, and more -- lots of fun activity to watch! Great outdoor pool. Hotel is located quite close (just a short walk) to Seaport Village. We would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place”
Reviews.Author: travelfaninpa
Reviews.Content: I love this place. Centrally located, within walking distance to the marina, villages with pubs and restaurants and stores, downtown, tour busses and more. Clean, comfortable, classy - this hotel in awesome! The fitness center has it all too - and I mean everything, state of the art equipment! Three pools, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Noise!”
Reviews.Author: hbsprite
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night with my wife and 1 year old child. We specifically asked for a quiet room and were placed in the north tower on the 17th floor in a room with a balcony. We were happy! We got settled, unpacked and were about to settle down for a good night's sleep. That is, until a freight train went by, constantly blowing its horn. It was so loud in the room, even with the door and drapes closed completely that you almost had to cover your ears. I'm not at all a light sleeper, but I had trouble sleeping due to being awoken every few hours. Our 1 year old didn't sleep very well either, as every time a train would come he would wake up crying. Internet access was $13 per day, which is definitely on the high side (should be free). In the morning, i took a closer look at the sliding door.....it has single pane glass! What were they thinking? Single pane glass in a hotel that overlooks heavily used train tracks? The simple addition of a dual paned sliding door would have made our stay so much better. Another oddity...the rooms (at least in the north tower) are very oddly shaped. Think triangle shaped instead of rectangle. The odd shape, gives the illusion of less "living space." We stayed here years ago and remember the water slide, which we thought would be fun to go down with our 1 year old. Turns out, they got rid of the water slide too :( On the plus side, the staff was friendly, the location was great and the room was very clean. Due to the noise issue, we would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: Countrylawyer
Reviews.Content: I recommend staying here. The location is perfect. I walked to my meetings downtown but still could enjoy the bay. I stayed on the concierge floor and after meeting the staff once-I was greeted by name for the rest of the week-no matter what part of the hotel I happened to see them in. I had my wife an three year old along with me--I couldn't believe how well everyone from the bellmen to the wait staff to the concierge staff treated my daughter. The fitness center was recently remodeled and is outstanding-with no fee for it's use.

Reviews.Title: “Many hotels in the area to chose from”
Reviews.Author: BIGtraveller66
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at this hotel for a conference. Most of the service was good with the exception of the pub/restaurant and front check-in. We too (as other reviews indicated) were mislead about the upgrades and they failed to provide us with the rate we reserved with. We are contacting head office about this issue since we paid 35$/night extra????
